chat.content: I'm Daphne, your dream come true.
Come on, don't be a tease.
Well, if you're really that interested in me... I'm from a city called Kenovice.
Sounds like you get around a lot.
You can say that, yeah! I've been to many places in my time.
What's your favourite thing to do?
Who's your favourite person on the world?
Everybody I can get my hands on.
Everybody's got to have a vice.
What can you tell me about TRACHI?
Yeah? Why don't come closer and say that again?
I've been having a lot of them, lately.
You got any cool stories to tell?
Sure, which one would you like to hear?
Couple of years ago, wasn't it?
Maybe you forgot, but I'll remember it forever.
Do you know what it means to dissociate?
Have you ever been in pain?
Imagine sacrificing a part of yourself.
That doesn't explain why you're here, though.
Do you think people like us feel pain as well?
You're the one who should answer that.
As far as I'm concerned, my pain is real.
You don't need to be. After all, it's the reason why we met.
Technically, I could let you in... But you'd need a visum first.
Sorry, I can't let you do that.
Getting a bit uppity, aren't you?
This entire situation get's more ridiculous by the minute.
The world's weirdest custom's office, for sure.
Seems much more like an asylum for the mentally deranged to me...
Are you sure we can trust him?
Don't you worry about that! I made it more than clear to him that he better not mess this up!
A lot of initiative... For a counsellor.
While I was out in the field, a letter from the Mayor arrived. Unfortunately, he decided to rescind your invitation to the city.
You've got to be kidding me.
Hm? Where the hell is Ralph?
I'm here to speak to Mr. Patterson.
Who knows. But one thing's for sure... The people deserve to know what's going on.
You guys are insane. If you want to throw your lives away, then go ahead! But do you have any idea how many people you're going to get killed?
Yeah. But there's no other way.
I can't believe you... Not content to put me through hell once, are you? No. Once again... You take everything that is dear to me... And grind it into dust.
There's no need to apologize. You're just doing what's best for yourself. But you know what... Two can play that game.
Eccentric to say the least! Though I bet he's also got gentle and soft side! ♥
Third time's the charm, huh? So... What's on the menu?

Alright, I guess. Some days are better, others are worse. Time seems to pass a lot quicker, though. Think I'm finally getting used to it. I guess that makes two of us, hm? Sorry. I haven't been talking to people a lot, lately.
Stopped seeing me around three months ago.
He got what he wanted. I told him the entire thing. Funny, isn't it? Three years in Tartarus... Just like that.
So it was you, after all.
Hm. He had it coming, I guess. On that note... I think I owe you an apology.
Don't worry about it. You did what you thought was right. Just like the rest of us. In any case... I can arrange for you to see someone else, if you want. Someone who can keep his mouth shut.
You don't get it, do you? It doesn't matter who I talk to. I've played my part. The rest is up to you.
Bullshit! Listen... I can't even begin to comprehend the things you must've gone through. But you know this isn't the end of the road for you!
Do me a favour, will you? Drop that in a bin on your way out.
I can't force you to read it. And frankly, I'd like to leave the choice to you, anyway. But if you're going along with this... Please, do it soon.
You might be the one to visit me, next time.
I see. Alright. You got my word.
Thank you. I'll be going, then.
If you know what's good for you... You better pray that they'll never let me leave this place.
Hm. I guess we'll see about that.
Man... Can this guy get himself a typewriter, already?
I'm not sure if that's an assurance or a threat... But I appreciate the sentiment.
I'd hate to be a party-pooper. But there's a custom's office I'd like to have another look at. If you guys don't mind, of course!
Woah! Outsiders! Y-you're not one of those mercenaries, are you?
You're damn right we are! Here to claim what's ours at last!
Hey, you! Can I interest you in some jewelry, perhaps? Everything made here in Nestville, of course!
A bit crude for my taste... How much you willing to let it go for?
Mmh, let me think... How about three lesser vouchers?
Do you accept Trachma by any chance?
Nothing, really. Just mistook me for someone else. Let's see if we can get an appointment with the councillor, now. Let's keep on looking.
Mind telling me what you're trying to do here?
Considering you're the one throwing random questions at people... How about you introduce yourself?
There's something I want to check out real quick... Mind accompanying me?
I was wondering when you'd turn up.
So? You came here to gloat, or what?
I wish I had the time to.
I would love to. But I wouldn't be able to play it half as good as you.
Maybe. But I guess we'll find out, one day.
Perhaps, yeah. Until then, though... We've got some more urgent business to take care of.
Oh, so that's what it's about? They had to call you in, just for me?
You've been telling a lot of interesting stories, from what I heard.
Just the odd tale, here and there. Though I'd imagine Atlas and Gregor told you everything, already.
I'm sure. But I also bet there's a lot more than just that.
Glad to hear that. To be honest... I've grown a bit bored, lately. I've grown a bit bored, anyway.
They really know how to pick them, don't they?
We're not inside the city yet.
Considering our track record... We're about to get hit by a lightning strike.
That's what you said to me before Hermingrad.
This is different. I have barely any experience abroad.
It's a great opportunity to remedy that. Besides, you won't be working alone. Your associates will be more than able to compensate.
You know one of them, already. It's Atlas.
You've got to be kidding me.
He's been to Trachi, before. And he knows her better than anyone else. Which is why I need someone to keep an eye on him, while he's there.
Because the two of you have a history.
I don't see how that's relevant.

There's something you need to understand about Atlas... He can't help but feel responsible for all the misery in the world. Including what happened to you. My point is... Atlas won't be able to see you straight. I know I'm asking for a lot. So I'll leave it up to you.
If I do it... You'll have to tell me everything you know about him. Including what happened between him and my dad.

Curious, isn't it? Here is Fero, with one of our best men at his disposal... An operative who's not only been born and raised in Trachi... But also desperately wants to bring it back. And yet, he has his mind set on someone else.
One of his protégés from the external branch. A former CoExA member, unsurprisingly. Have you ever heard of an agent called Ganymede?
I couldn't possibly put that on you.
You don't need to worry about me. I can handle him.
I'm sure you can. But I'd rather not overcomplicate things. I'll have a word with him, tomorrow.
Thank you for bringing this to my attention. I'm sure we can find a way to fix all this.
As long as his wife is safe, he'll do anything.
In the meantime... We should focus on dealing with two issues. First, the Tanner situation. We know far too litle of him.
What do you know about him?
Not much. He's a founding member of the Republican Guard. Used to be a mobster. But Faber managed to mobilize him for his cause.

And then there's also Amryn to deal with. For this reason, we've activated one of our assetts in the administration. The administrator of Filmore, to be precise. He's agreed to facilitate a meeting with Faber, this evening. At his house in Filmore Avenue. I'll need the two of you to prepare his house for our hit. Daphne.
You'll take care of the upper level, including our man himself.
I'll go and get into position. See you there.
I have a bad feeling about this. ...
This has to be a trap.
I don't think we have a lot of options. This might be our last shot to get him.
Wandering like that into the lion's den, though? Let me call for backup, at the very least.
We don't have time for that. If you don't want to come, I can understand that.
You know I'm not allowed to leave you out of my sight.
What the fuck are you doing here?
It's been a while. But me and Ralph, we go way back, you know. Anyways... I need you to answer a few questions for me.

Aww... No need to get all uppity! I'm not here to hurt you. All I need is for you to tell me a little something. And in return... I'll let you know what happened to your friend. Yes. The blonde one. He's adorable, isn't he?

Eury... I thought you were smarter than this. That's right... I know who you are. I read all about your little trip to this city... Two years ago. You fucked that one up, didn't you? Seduced by a double agent... Pathetic. And to top it off... You didn't even have the spine to stand up for it. Instead, you crawled from one shack to the other. Until you finally found someone desperate enough to take you in. So what's the deal? Did you suck your host dry already?

Bright one, aren't we? So proud of your homework! But I've got some bad news for you, little one. You already lost. When was the last time you saw Atlas, I wonder? And with that boy being interrogated right now... It's just you... And me.
I'm starting to see why he respects you so much. So tell me... What was it like? Seeing the man you fell in love with pound your little sister, instead? What was her name again? Lorna?
I see... Getting to her won't be easy.
What about our man in the parliament?
He's at odds with Faber, from what I know.
Maybe. I'd rather not activate him, so soon. Let's give him until tomorrow.
Not sure how to say this...
He's an oddity, alright. But I wouldn't underestimate him.
Doesn't the same go for yourself?
It's just... I can't put my finger on it. But something about him is seriously off.
Listen... I don't know what you're trying to do here. But I'd focus on my objectives, if I were you. And I'm not saying this for my sake. Hyperion doesn't appreciate detours. Take it from me.
I'm doing what can to the best of my abilities, no?
A bit harsh, but I'll take it.
That's not what I mean. There's gotta be something.
You know what I'm referring to.
I'm sure he's already told you everything you need to know. Or maybe not. Because otherwise you wouldn't be here, right?
It's because of her, isn't it?
So why didn't you turn her in?
Are you sure you can do this?
She used to be your handler, didn't she? That business with her sister...
I'm just trying to understand... Your relationship to someone who has been AWOL for almost two years.
We parted ways long before that.
Until she disappeared. And you were sent to find her. So again... Why didn't you turn her in?
All good, don't worry. It just... Feels like we're about to cross a line with what we're doing.
Don't know if it makes you feel any better... But it's not easy on me, either.
I wasn't sure, to be honest. You always seem so confident. Got me a bit envious, to be honest!
Awww... That's how you see me? Guess I'm that good at hiding it.
Have you ever done anything like this before?
Thought as much. So, what's next?

I'm gonna relay that the stage for tonight is set. As for you... One of our contacts in the Guard has asked for a meeting. Normally, Atlas would handle stuff like that. But he's off on some goose-chase after one of Amryn's people. So I guess you'll have to do the honours.
His name is Arnold Francesco Solka.

Sort of. We know something he doesn't want us to know. So we do each other a little favour, here and there. Anyways... There's a chance our hit tonight won't be enough. If that's the case... We'll need his troops.
There's more. Tanner might become a problem, down the line. So, hopefully... Solka can fill in some of the gaps for us.
The prefecture in Sigmund Plaza. His office. Second floor.

You'll be running under the identity of a corporal named Theodore Harrington. The name's in their books, so it should stand scrutiny. And of course... We also got you a uniform. So as long as you're not sniffing around too much... You'll be fine.
Alright. I'll go and get changed, then.
It's a bit stiff in places. But it'll do.
Don't do anything I wouldn't do.
Sigmund Plaza, south of Anderson Park.
It's been a busy couple of days. How's Ganymede?
Is he on his way back, already?
Not sure. He was still around when I left. But I'd assume he'll leave soon.
Did you manage to find her?
Yup. She's even younger than I expected.
Yeah. Told me the entire story.
Alright. Should we go and see Tanner, then?
I would say so. You know where he lives?
Corner house in Farblein Trail. Second floor.
I'm not sure. But there's something in the air.
You know where the Old Admirality is?
Think it was on the eastern tail of the city, right?
We still don't have our papers. Let's return later.
Hudsam Corner. That big building over there is the district's central workshop. And the seat of Rondham's administration.
Hm? We're already at the port?
The big building over there... That's the Old Admirality?
Boy, do I hope she's right.
Looks like you were right, after all.
Well... The guy I needed to speak to is on lunch break. So I guess I'm gonna have to wait until he's back.
Yeah. No need to wait on me, though. Actually, could you do me a favour and drop this off at our place?
Yeah. Our man left it behind.
Alright. I'll see you later, then.
Hello, Mrs. Can I interest you in a glass?
Very kind of you. But I'll have to pass, I'm afraid.
What about an entire bottle, then?
You're not wandering off, are you?
I'm glad we're able to see eye to eye on this.
To be fair... It's not like I have much of a choice, do I?
There's always a choice. And I'm sure a man like you is clever enough to figure out which path to take.
Whatever you say. But I'd like to keep Lily out of this, if possible.
Of course! Very sorry about the intrusion. But we need to make sure this place is prepared. For all of our sakes.
The mere the idea of something like that happening in my house...
I can understand that. Which is why it's important that there's no hiccups.
I can trust you to uphold your side of the deal, as well?
Naturally! She'll be taken care of. You have to understand, however... That custom's won't let anyone through, until we're done.
Just get her out before anything bad happens.
Don't worry. She'll be well protected. Did you tell her?
I don't think there's any need to.
Asking Faber for a meeting might look suspicious.
Your wife... She used to be close friends with Mrs. Faber, right?
We need you to reactivate that bond... Make it look like the entire thing was her idea.
You are out of your mind. This will put her right in the line of fire!
I don't think so. Unless word about her family gets out, of course.
I know it's a hard sell. Then again... I'm sure that both Mrs. Faber and Liliane would love the idea.
He's stubborn, from what I heard. But if you give him something he desperately wants... He'll bite, I'm sure! There's a motion tabled in Parliament, no?
You want me to support him?
If that's what it takes... Do it.
Just give us a sign once you've brought him up here. We'll take care of the rest.
And what's that going to be?
Are you sure you want to know?
Alright. Time to wrap it up. Sorry, Icarus.
Jesus... Were you trying to give me a heart attack?
Awww... Are you that happy to see me?
What the hell are you doing here?
Come on, now! That's no way to treat an old friend!
Relax, for god's sake! You know, Icarus... I think the two of us need to have a conversation.
There's a boy with us. And I want to understand him better.

Icarus... Why do we always have to play this stupid game? I know about the two of you... You told me, remember? That business with General Forten, two years ago... And how much fun the two of you had. God, I wish I could have been part of that!
So that's what it's all about? You're still pissed?

Jesus. Listen, Icarus... I don't care who or what you're screwing. What I do care about... Is that this operation doesn't get fucked because one of our agents is playing boy scout. I know it's what he does. Acting like that. And I gotta hand it to him... He's very, very good at it. But there's a question on my mind. If we're on the same side... Why is he pulling that shit on us? Tell me, Icarus.
Listen, Daph... I know you're very invested in your job. But you've got to realize... That we're all just trying to get by.
You're absolutely right. Which is why I need you to tell me.
I'm getting tired of this. I'll go take a shower. Make yourself comfortable... If you haven't, already. Come on.
There's really no need for that.
This isn't funny, you know. Jesus! Are you insane?
I won't miss again. Face the wall to your right. On your knees.
You really have no boundaries, do you?
Is this your new kink? Because I really don't know what kind of statement you're trying to make.

Much better. What's that? I'm sorry... But I can't hear you like that. In any case... I'm afraid I don't have the time to play cat and mouse with you. So the next time you open your mouth... You better say something productive. Ganymede. Trojan boy. Why is he here?
Alright, alright! I get it. There was a message from Fero. That Gany was on his way.
I'm supposed to keep an eye on him. Just in case.
That's all there is to it. What the fuck was that for?
You're not telling the truth. Fero must've given you a reason, at least.
I don't think I was ever considered.
You were among the top four. Fero never told you about it?
I honestly don't care what kind of politics they're playing, up there. As long as it brings the city home.
Well, if it's like that... You'll have to make a choice. Because not everyone's on our side.
All I can say... Is that Gany's exceptional at his job. He's putting up a show, for sure... But he's doesn't stab his own people in the back. Or cuff them for no fucking reason.
Right. I think that's enough of an introduction, anyway.
Sorry... But you're on the list.

It's decided. No reason to hold back, anymore. For both of us. Almost twelve. Six hours, give or take. Until then, I need you to tell me everything you know about Ganymede. Everything the two of you did together. And everything that this son of a bitch Fero is planning. Consider it your last confession. Hm, I see... You just can't wait to get underway, can you? Alright. Brace yourself.
Yes. It's all set up. But I need one of your men to cover me. Just in case.
How much time do you need?
Poor guy. Isn't he one of your people?
That's what I'm trying to find out.
So... Are you gonna let him go, now?
Considering both Atlas and Orpheus are still at large... I doubt that's a good idea. Then again, I promised you. So I'd like to hear your opinion on it.
He's utterly broken. But I agree. It's too risky to set him loose.
There might be a way to use him, though. And maybe... Flush both Atlas and Orpheus out.
Alright. But if he's going there... He'll need a new identity.
Right. And I just happen to know the perfect handle.
Good. I'll leave the details to you.
No, thank you. You've been an incredible help the past few years. If there weren't that many reservations about age... I'd have named you as Fero's successor.
I'm honoured. But I don't think I'm ready for politics, yet.
No one ever is. You'd certainly make a better secretary than any of the half-wits at this table. Speaking of that... I'll have to get ready for the meeting.
Of course. Is there anything else you need from me?
Not at the moment, no. It's been a busy couple of days. If there's no complications, today... Both of us will have a lot of work on our hands, very soon. So why don't you go and get some rest?
I'll have my assistant call you tomorrow.
Alright. Thank you. And good luck.
Always an eye for details, huh?
You know how it is. Some things never change.
Why are you looking at me like that?
Sorry, Daph. But I had to make sure.

You asked me why I didn't turn Eury in, right? n<AtlasIt's true. I have to protect her. But not from us. Pravoskos told you, didn't he? We needed to put up a show for Eury. So she could get close to Lorentz.
Not yet. But they've set up a meeting.
And you think he's really here?
He has to be. His fingerprints are all over Amryn's movements Including Ganymede.
Yeah. You were right about him.
He really was working for Lorentz, then?
All the signs are pointing to it.
A shame. He's a very bright young man.
Some people can't be trusted, I guess.
Right. You want to send him back?
Yeah. It was fun, while it lasted... But I already got what I wanted from him.
Alright. I'll file the papers once we get back.
Okay. Something still bothers me, though.
I don't know... It just feels like I don't know who to trust, anymore.
Welcome to my world. The bad news is, you'll never get used to| it. But we can try, at least. Looks like they're ready. You want to see this?
Yeah. Let's get it over with.
Still in the archives. But I've got someone watching him.
I see. I take it you've heard the news?
Did you plan for this to happen?

Of course not! As a matter of fact, this incident puts us in a highly problematic spot. The mayor will have no choice but to go after us now. With everything he's got. Worse yet... The death of his daugther will certainly put the general public behind him. As for us... We had to make our move a lot sooner than originally planned. How did it go on your end?
We've managed to secure the perimeter. For the time. But I hope Solka's men are on their way.
He's been notified. It shouldn't take them long to get here. What about the other members of the staff here? I'm going to need a list of all the people with acess to this building.
Do you think she should be here?
I don't know where else she'd be safe.
You understand she poses a security risk, right? If you want, we could bring her to one of our safehouses.
I appreciate the offer. But I'm sure you'll understand your recent track record in that area isn't promising. I'd rather keep her close to me.
Alright. Just know that she can't be involved into any of this. For your and her sake, mainly.
Yeah, I get it. So, what's the next step?

First order of business is to establish a safe supply route back to Ionia. Since the guardsmen at the checkpoint are unlikely to cooperate, we need to rely on alternative methods. In other words, we're going to need ships. And lots of them. We need an account of everything that can be used as transport. Including small crafts, such as Gondole.
You're asking me to disown my own citizens.

Only temporarily... Once we've established control over the checkpoint, everyone will get their property back. I think you know this already... But we can't use any forces oficially affiliated with Ionia. Not until Amryn has made their move. Which means... There is no other option here. Apart from fending completely on our own. And I think you of all people are aware how long this city can survive without food supplies.
Alright. I guess there's no helping it. In return however, I want something from you, as well. I don't care about status or position. What I do care about is that Lily.
Of course. If anything goes wrong, she's the among the first to be exfiltrated. And returned to her tometown safely.
I hope I can believe your word.
On that note... Once Ionia has gained control over the city...
You'll be free, as agreed. Retire to the countryside with your wife... Or keep serving as governor. It's your call.
Very well... What about the others?
That depends on him. From our end, we're open to negotiation. But I doubt he's willing to talk after what happened.
And that's only the intro. Do you like it, so far?
Hm. You really think he's worth all that?
Silly girl. I told you I'm not in this for someone else. All I care about... Is to see things burn. So how about it? Want me to put a stop to it?
You really enjoy this, don't you?
Am I supposed to feel guilty for that?
Not at all. On the contrary... You did everything just the way we wanted you to.
Really? I think you're bluffing, Daph.

I thought you might say that. It just fits you so perfectly well. And since you're trying so hard to keep that mask of yours up... I'm going to enjoy this even more than I thought! You like to see things burn, you said. There's about twenty to thirty armed men outside. God... The suspense is killing me. Alright. Here we go.
Your colleague is here as well?
I take it you've heard the news?
Did you plan for this to happen?

Of course not! As a matter of fact, this incident puts us in a highly problematic spot. The mayor will have no choice but to go after us now. With everything he's got. Worse yet... The death of his daugther will certainly put the general public behind him. As for us... We had to make our move a lot sooner than originally planned. How did it go on your end?
We've managed to secure the perimeter. For the time. But I hope Solka's men are on their way.
He's been notified. It shouldn't take them long to get here. What about the other members of the staff here? I'm going to need a list of all the people with acess to this building.
Do you think she should be here?
I don't know where else she'd be safe.
You understand she poses a security risk, right? If you want, we could bring her to one of our safehouses.
I appreciate the offer. But I'm sure you'll understand your recent track record in that area isn't promising. I'd rather keep her close to me.
Alright. Just know that she can't be involved into any of this. For your and her sake, mainly.
Yeah, I get it. So, what's the next step?

In other words, we're going to need ships. And lots of them. We need an account of everything that can be used as transport. Including small crafts, such as Gondole.
You're asking me to disown my own citizens.

Only temporarily... Once we've established control over the checkpoint, everyone will get their property back. I think you know this already... But we can't use any forces oficially affiliated with Ionia. Not until Amryn has made their move. Which means... There is no other option here. Apart from fending completely on our own. And I think you of all people are aware how long this city can survive without food supplies.
Alright. I guess there's no helping it. In return however, I want something from you, as well. I don't care about status or position. What I do care about is that Lily.
Of course. If anything goes wrong, she's the among the first to be exfiltrated. And returned to her tometown safely.
I hope I can believe your word.
On that note... Once Ionia has gained control over the city...
You'll be free, as agreed. Retire to the countryside with your wife... Or keep serving as governor. It's your call.
Very well... What about the others?

That depends on him. From our end, we're not unwilling to go back to the negotiation table. But I doubt he's willing to talk after what happened. Not after what happened yesterday. That being said, if there's nothing else to discuss... I'm going to get some rest.
Trying to make the best out of a bad situation. On that matter–
Before you continue, there's one thing I need to know first.
Yes, yes... She is safe, I assure you.
I'd like to see her, if that's possible.
In due time, Mr. Hendricks. First, we need to make sure that Rondham and its sorrounding area is safe.
You don't need to be concerned about that. Farnswood has already withdrawn his men back to Trenton Plaza. He can't afford to keep a presence here.
Oh, he'll have his hands full, alright. And soon, that is.
How is the operation in Reginald coming along?
We don't know, yet. But if all went well, we should hear from them, soon.
Yup. We better go upstairs. It's starting.
Alright. Through here. Up the ladder.
I thought we were past this.
That's not what I mean. I'm not faulting you. To be honest... It's much a better cause than anything I have.
Hm. What is it for you, then?
Joy. To see something dismantled. And rebuilt. That's why I'm here.
Nice speech. But we both know it's bullshit. You're here because your boss wants my boss out. Everything else is just a narrative to cope with that fact. So tell me... Am I on the hitlist, too?
If I was supposed to kill you two...
Neither of is. Fero can fuck himself. The only reason why I do these things... Is because it turns me on.
Hm... So you'll tell me eveyrthing?
I checked for his keys... But they were gone, already.
As you said it. Furthermore, the checkpont is to be reopened immediately and all patrols on the eastern river are to cease.
Including the deployment of any defensive measures.
How do you know about this?
That's not important. What matters is that you comply.
Hey! You had us scared there, for a bit.
Only bits and pieces. Think I slipped or something. After that, it's just a big blur. How did I get here?
Atlas. You should have seen the look on his face! Don't beat yourself up. Some people enjoy playing hero, once in a while.
Yeah. Having a chat with Mr. Mayor.
Speaking of... I gotta get going, too.
Right. Sorry to keep you away from that.
No worries! It's your first time in Trachi, right?
How about you tag along? And I'll give you a lay of the land while we're at it? If you don't mind, of course.
Great! There's a bunch of clothes in that drawer over there. Unless you prefer to go out as is, of course.
I had to. You were drenched from top to bottom, after all.
Well, guess I can't hide anything from you, anymore.
You should have never tried to, in the first place. Anyways... I'll wait for you outside.
Damn it. There's got to be something.
Yeah, about that... Care to tell me where the fuck you've been?
It's a long story. And we don't have a lot of time.
Right. So... What did he say?
The thing with Solka... Was that him?
According to Sternlein, yeah. They pressured him into suicide.
How's the situation at the OA?
I wish I could tell you. But I spent the entire night working Gany.
I see. What did he tell you?
Not much. A few things about Fero. The usual tripe about how you're trying to backstab us.
He met Orpheus, a few months ago, apparently. Random chance.
Yeah. It's got to be him.
You know... It's been a while since the two of us did something together.
Not like I had much of a choice.
Yeah. And I'm sorry about that. But if you're up for it... We'll pay De Bloom a visit.
I've got a few questions for him. About that Tillian guy he sent with us. And after we're done with him... We'll go and see Ganymede.
To be honest... I was a bit worried that you've grown soft. But now that you've got me all worked up... You better take responsibility.
Isn't that what I've been doing, the entire time?
You know how it is. It's the climax that counts!
I didn't expect you to be so interested in a girl's room.
They got the bullet out. One of your kidneys, though... Let's just say I wouldn't rely on it, if I were you.
Funny... I wanted to say the same thing about you.
You brought this on yourself, you know.
Yeah. By trusting you, for starters. So? What's the verdict?
Well... Eury is dead, thanks to you.
For the record... That one wasn't planned.
You pulled that trigger, Daph. And there's no way to ever take that back.
That's exactly my point. So unless you want to become like me... You better start living with yourself.
Honestly, Atlas... Cry me a fucking river.
There'll be time for that, don't worry. But first... I've got to deal with you.
Oh, I'm sorry. Why don't you get the fuck on with it, then?
Ariadne and Ganymede. That was you, wasn't it?
Thanks. But I really didn't do that much.
On the contrary. Ganymede's already across the border. Coupled with Icarus being KIA... That's three CoExA agents dead and one in custody.
Not a bad yield for three days.
Yeah. I bet Hyperion will be very proud of you.
A bit of a mixed bag. On one hand, I'd very much like to strangle you, right now. But then again... I won't need to worry about abusing you, ever again.
Adorable. A shame you've got to trade me in for Gany, so soon.
He's gonna let his own brother rot away in Ionia?
If that's how you like to see it.
Wow. I always knew you were a sadistic piece of shit. But this takes the bloody cake!
Don't misunderstand me. When I said I'd abuse you... I didn't mean emotionally. Not like I wouldn't enjoy it, of course. But ultimately... Someone needs to keep a watch on our friend.
To cover you. And the story you'll tell them.
So, are you going to do it or not?
You're out of your mind if you think I'm helping you with that!
Were you ever convicted? "What does the insignia of Trachi depict?" "Underscore the prime numbers in the following list." Is there a system to these questions, at all?
Apart from trying to provoke a killing spree, you mean?
Correct. But we shouldn't jump to conclusions. Let's focus on the task ahead.
As soon as we're inside the city... I'll find the clerk responsible for this questionnaire. And once I do... I'll take his stupid forms and shove them so far up his bureaucratic b-
If they're so keen on cooperating, why pull a stunt like this?
Either way, musing on it won't help. Another fifteen minutes pass...
You can't possibly imagine... How much I'm going to enjoy this!
At least you're honest about it.
Not really. But it's a nice change of pace.
Thank you. I hope you won't mind if we jump right into it.

I have a theory. About the way you work, I mean. And why no one knows anything about you. There's a little place in your mind. Almost as old as you. Everytime your bratty mouth gets you into trouble... You disappear inside.
I'm flattered. But I don't think it's anything to write home about. You've got one of those, too, don't you? Dotty?

We all do. Some need a little nudge. Others require a special key. You see... There's just way too much bullshit coming out of your mouth! So I can't trust anything you say. Whoops! Very sorry! Hey! You okay, down there? Good! Anyways... Where was I? Oh, right! Fortunately for me... There's more than one way for a body to express itself. So I'm just gonna keep going... Until I find out who you're really working for.
There's something I got to ask you.
What De Bloom said about you and Eury... Is it true?
Why did you never mention it?
I told you that I'd protect her.
You know I don't really care about that.
Let's try another angle, then. What if she's responsible for the Lorna thing?
Can't say I agree with your motives. But alright.
Okay. Let's go and see Gany.
Right. He's in the archives, down in the basement.
This is it, hm? You ready?
Now that we're all here. Let's talk terms.
You think so? I was rather hoping you'd put up more of a fight.
Sorry to disappoint you. But there's no need for me to resist. You've got my brother, don't you?
I figured as much. So... What do you want?
Well, for starters... You're gonna come with us. We'll haul both of you back to Ionia. And then, we'll squeeze every little detail out of you, your precious little brother... And that bitch of yours.
Oh my. So confident. Reminds me of myself when I was your age.
With one key difference... I never lost.
I see. That's disappointing. But it doesn't change anything.
That's right. You'll join him, soon, anyway.
Really? And why would that be?
You still grasped it? You're outnumbered.
I can count well enough, thank you very much.

He set it all up. From start to finish. Every piece of the puzzle, right there... Apart from one thing. How did Hyperion know that Lorna wanted to run away? I had no clue. And neither did Eury. Lorna never told any of us. Did she?

Hm. You got me right there. It's weird isn't it? She made me promise not to tell either of you. You know why? Because as much as both of you loved her... You never really listened to anything she said. Of all the people in the world... I was the only one who knew what she was going through. And yeah. I told Hyperion.
That Lorna wanted to get away from it all.
I'm sure we can find a way to fix all this.
Daph. You know the story, now. The sides are set. And the masks are dropped. I'll give you a choice. Join us, and we'll make him pay.

Atlas. I meant what I said. There's no one on this world I love more than you. You saved me from a monster. But Hyperion picked me up. He showed me something I'm good at. And I'm not willing to give that up for a person who's been dead for more than four years.
Go and tell Hyperion... I'm coming for him.
Are you having a laugh? There's no way I'll let the three of you off, like that.
You're welcome to try. But I'd rather not waste any time, if I were you.
Oh? And why would that be?
You never read Solka's letter, did you?
I don't think there's any need for that. Not for you, at least. But for everyone who doesn't know... I'm sure they'll appreciate all the details behind what happened, back then.
You heard me. It's public knowledge, now.
Are you insane? If Amryn gets wind of that-
You'd go this far, just for her?
She was right, you know. Ionia is a monstrosity.
As if Amryn were any better.
Huh? Who's paying your bills then?
No one. You said it yourself. People like us can't help ourselves. Just like this city... We want to be free.
This just gets better and better. You think you can cause a war and get away with it? The entire IIS will be up your arse in a week!
We'll see about that. Just keep in mind that we have a list. And your name's on it, too.
Now that's more like it. Alright, let's have it your way.
Right. I'll remind you of that when I come back and put this city to the torch.
Feel free to. Not today, though.
Sounds like you get around a lot.
You can say that, yeah! I've been to many places in my time.
What's your favourite thing to do?
What do you do for a living?
Who's your favourite person on the world?
I'd guess I'm about as dangerous as you.
Who do you think you're talking to?
Who knows. Though I can promise you one thing.
Whoever you are. I'll find out.
I'll find out if you're accountable or not.
Spying on us. Killing us. Remakin us. Ripping our own world straight from our hands.
That isn't how conversations work. You know that, right?
Why are you trying to flatter me?
And yet you're still talking to me. It's almost like you've got a reason to.
What do you know about this place?
I've been having a lot of them, lately.
There's a lot of cities out there.
Because I've felt you being there.
I'm just trying to make conversation, okay?
Then why don't you tell me about yourself, instead?
Sure! What would you like to know?
How does it feel to be alive?
Bit of a hard question, isn't it?
You'd like to me to ask you an easier question?
What's your name? Where are you from?
It's fine. You can answer them in your own time.
Is that where you are right now?
Because I've heard someone call you Aron before.
And you're assuming that's my real name?
Would you take my word for it?
I can't judge until I've heard it, right?
There's nothing left for us to do here.
We have some business to discuss with him. He's expecting us.
Yeah? Not that I would have heard.
So? Will you go and fetch him, then?
Not allowed to leave my post, unfortunately.
Sorry, I don't make the rules.
Are you saying we're supposed to wait for him here until he just happens to stroll by?
Well... You're not from Trachi, are you?
Get to the point, if you please.
Technically, I could let you in... But you'd need a visum first.
Let's say we'd want to acquire one.
The custom's office, perhaps? God, I really have to spell everything out for you, don't I?
You call that spelling? It's like I'm watching a dog trying to do his taxes!
Let's not waste any more time, then. As for you. We'll be back.
Hey, long time no see. Let me guess... You've lost your way again, haven't you? As much as I'd like to personally hold your hand at every step-

Shut it. Enough of your bullshit. Now, you listen to me. And listen very carefully. I know Tanner is in there. And I know that he knows we're here. So you either go in there right now and fetch him... Or I swear I'll drag him out here myself!
That's what it always comes down to, eh?
You Ionians are all the same.
Like I would know! Checking out some place in the forest. At least so I heard.
At the very least we get to see a bit more of the countryside.
We're already behind schedule, as it is. But I guess there's no helping it... Let's go.
You're a funny one! I thought they'd beat that out of you Shiteonians a long time ago!
Enough of that. Is the Lieutenant back?
Let's go. We've wasted more than enough time on idle nonfactors.
This entire situation get's more ridiculous by the minute.
Seems that way. But there's a limit to idiosyncratic tolerance. Let's have another word with that cryptic guardsman.
Seems much more like an asylum for the mentally deranged to me...
I think they're far more apt than we give them credit for. In any case, Tanner should be back by now.
Can I help you, by any chance?
Mind pointing us to the barracks?
Of course! It's right over there.
Glad to have you back! We're almost there.
Don't you guys worry about that! I made it more than clear to him that he better not mess this up!
A lot of initiative... For a counsellor.

Anyways... You guys need a brief on anything? We are about to reach our side of the border close to Trachi's eastern checkpoint. Once we're there, we'll make contact with our man in the republican guard. Who will hand us the necessary papers to enter the city.
Can't we just go through the main gate?
Theoretically, yeah. Though there have been reports that Ionians are being subjected to heavy delays in their passport proceedings. So we'd rather not take any chances.

Once we're inside, we'll disperse and make our way to the safehouse, individually. And support the embassy by gathering intelligence throughout the city. It's vital that the negotiations between Trachi and our government proceed without any incidents.
Talks have been deadlocked for the last few weeks, so I heard.

That is correct. And even though we can't be sure what the reason for this is... It's likely that Amryn was involved. Whatever the case might be, though. We're here to change that. Within the next three days, that is.
And what if nothing happens by the end of it?

Let's hope it won't come to that. Now, I think you're already aware of this. But for the record... We're not formally recognized by the committee. In other words... Once we've crossed the border, we'll be stateless. Alright. Let's go.
We could try another set of passports. Though I doubt we'll even get to the first screening today.
If they don't find another reason to deny us again, that is.
How about we use the rest of the day to have a look around? And if all else fails, we can still be first in line, tomorrow.
Enjoyed your little stroll around the countryside?
Considering we're already several hours behind schedule... I'd rather skip the pleasantries.
Alright, have it your way. Now, I'm afraid you won't like what I'm going to say next.
While I was out in the field, a letter from the Mayor arrived. Unfortunately, he decided to rescind your invitation to the city.
You've got to be kidding me.
You do realize you're violating an international agreement?

Whatever the case might be. It's out of my hands. You're not barred from entering the city through regular means, of course. But I'm afraid this particular route is closed to you. Now, if there's nothing else to discuss... I must formally ask you to leave Trachian territory. Unless you prefer to be escorted from the premises, of course.
That won't be necessary. We'll be going.
Over here. If you'd be so kind.
Hm? Where the hell is Ralph?
That's a good question. Let's take a look upstairs.
We still have some business here.
To you, as well. Say, I was wondering if you could help me. This is the Elysian, right?
You have the keys for the apartment?
Should be here, any moment, now. What about Daphne?
She's hard to predict. But I think we got her cornered.
I told him what he needed to hear. But everything beyond that... Your guess is better than mine.
Hm. You know I haven't seen him in years.
Yeah... But some people never change.
And you were faster than I had expected. I assume you found out about it, then?
To be fair... It wasn't that hard to put the pieces together.
How long have you been investigating him?
Pretty much from the moment he defected to us.
Figures... And you've been tracking me, as well?
I don't think I have to tell you that. If I am to guess, she'll come walking through that door within the next minutes, as well. From the moment he defected to us.
I'm not sure how you pulled that one of. But I'm quite honestly impressed.
And you. So... What's it gonna be? I kill you, you kill me?
Hm... I guess you want to talk, beforehand?
About a couple of things, yeah.
Well, I'm not really a fan of getting interviewed.
Then let me do the talking.
Oh? Go ahead then. See if those tricks of yours work on me.
I'm not here to pressure you into something.
Yes, yes. We've all heard that line more times than any of us can stomach. Just get to the point, please.
Alright. I think you're well aware of the things my people have done.
Standing right next to the result of one of your recent ventures, I can attest to that.
I want your help in tearing it down.
Amryn. Trachi. Ionia. They all need to go.

You know I've done horrible, unspeakable things. Not that I'm super exceptional. In some wicked sense, I just happen to be really good at something that is terribly wrong. But I'd rather have a world in which I'm useless. Than thrive in one that incorporates so much human-made misery.
Terribly touching. But I'm afraid I don't really buy it.
Oh? That makes it even worse.
In any case... I'm not one for long speeches. So I'll get to the point. You lived in Nestville for more than a year. You saw what a world untouched by people like us can look like.
You're aware that no matter what you might have up your sleeve... This city is lost to you.
What do you mean by that?
Me and Eurydice have been working closely with the leader of the TLF.

I am aware of that. You were so kind as to give us a reason to finally fight this out on a battlefield. And if your intelligence is even half their reputation's worth, you know that you'll have no chance of winning a war.

You're right. Ionia will surely lose. Ionia will undoubtedly lose. However, Amryn is very likely to suffer heavy casualties. Every strip of land along the border has been heavily fortified. The Promeria is being turned into one big minefield while we're speaking.
Even so. You can't say that this is a win for you.
That depends on the objective. Naturally, I helped Ionia along some steps. But then again, you made good use of the information I gave you, as well.
Oh? Now that is rich. You're claiming that you are responsible for the leak?
Me and a few others, yeah.
To stall Ionia. In order for our plan to succeed, neither side was allowed to gain control over the city.
Eurydice likes to call it a revolution. But I'm much more reserved. Right now, we're nothing but dissidents. But we do have a fighting chance.
You're insane. There's no way the locals will acept that. Not after all the shit you've done to them.
Maybe. But as far as they're concerned, I'm dead. And the same goes for the IIB.
Pretty risky for you to come here, then.
It is. But it's also important for you to know the truth.
The truth, yeah? I still don't buy it.
I expected as much. You'll be leaving the city soon, I assume?
Alright. In any case, if you change your mind... You know how to contact us.
Wait! When did you find out?
... So... Nothing else you have to say about it?
Of course... You were the one who leaked Clara's location to us, in the first place.
But you didn't expect me to do what I did, right?
So why didn't you stop me?
I arrived when you stowed her body back inside. Which leads me to the question of what exactly happened, there.

... It was an accident. I went to the place described on the note. And found the spot where the girl was stashed. Some of the rainwater had already leaked into the pipe. That was part of your plan, right?
Those were the orders, yeah. Control wanted us to bring about a sense of... urgency.

I see... In any case though... When I saw the state of things, I was left with a choice. This man, right here. He wanted me to return the girl to the mayor. Those were my official orders. Those were my official orders. He wanted me to return the girl to the mayor.
That was part of your plan, right?
Because there's a part of me that would've done the same.
And it served your purpose, after all.
No. Do you regret it, then?
Does it ever get any easier?
Unfortunately, it does. Which is why it's important for us realize that things like these can't go on any longer.
If you really want to know.
My point is: We can't go on like this. There's a war about to happen. And as much we hate to admit it, we're partially to blame.
So, what are we going to do?

We can't stop it by ourselves. However, we can at least do something right. You and our people. We've prepared a full account of everything we've done. Tomorrow morning, these confessions are sent around the world.
You guys are insane. If you want to throw your lives away, then go ahead! But do you realize... How many people you're going to get killed?
Yeah. But there's no other way.
I can't believe you. You're dragging me through hell not once but twice. Once again, you take everything that is dear to me – and grind it into dust.
Don't bother. I think I'm done for.
Don't say that. I refuse to let you go.
It's a bit late for that, isn't it? But I do appreciate the sentiment.
Stop the melodramatic bullshit, already. You'll live, you hear me?!
You're right. Don't wait for me.
Forest shouldn't be far. Northeast, I think?
Sorry sir... But this area is closed off, at the moment.
That's the road to Nestville, right?
Well... I'm not really authorized to speak about that. We're doing our best to get the situation back under control, though!
Mind if we take a look ourselves?
As I said, the area's quite "precarious". I'd strongly advise you to turn around, while you have the chance.
Note taken. Now, would you move aside, please?
I'm just trying to talk sense into you.
I appreciate that. But if you don't move out of the way immediately, I'll have to make you.
Alright, I get it. If you're so keen on hurting yourself, be my guest.
We've got to be somewhere anyway.
I wonder what his deal with Tanner is...
Nothing that should concern us at any rate. Let's get a move on. We have to be inside the city by dusk.
Hey, you there! Mind doing me a favour, real quick?
Sorry. But we're just passing through.
It'll only take a minute! There's this lad living in that cabin, over there. My job's to check up on him... But he keeps telling me to sod off.
Come on, guys! My career's on the line here, damn it!
Sounds like a you problem to me.
Some people have a hard time letting go. But I doubt that you're here to discuss memorabilia.
Right. There's a man named Heinrich. A former member of the guard.
Does the name Julius Gaston ring any bells?
That old fool is still around?
Partly, yes. He was apprehended by the Guard, an hour ago.
Happens to a lot of people these days. He's always been too eager for his own good. But he's not the reason you're here, right?
We need to enter the city. Today, that is.
You sure about that? I'd rather get as far away as possible, if I were you.
It's not for us to decide.

Well, I can't help you with that. But there's a small community up north, called Nestville. Tell them that I sent you. Don't know if anything good comes from it... But seeing as you're here... It's probably your best shot.
Don't mention it! Now, if you'd excuse me, I'd rather not be involved any more than necessary.
Can we stop here for a second?
There's a question I want to ask.
I understand we have to keep a low profile. But we are still in the DMZ right?
So why let this guy act like he owns the place?
He's still our best lead into the city. And an important figure beyond that, as well. That's why we have to cooperate, for now.
I see. You think he'll keep his word?
Maybe. But he knows what's at stake. That's not what you wanted to ask me, though, right?
Right. See, I might be wrong on that. But he's awfully well informed.
The way you two looked at each other... As if you've met before. Now, I'm not gonna pry. But he might exploit this, given the chance.
What I'm trying to say is: We don't have a lot of friends out here, as you mentioned. Just the three of us to watch each other's back.
I'm not sure if that's an assurance or a threat... But I appreciate the sentiment.
I'd hate to interrupt your little bonding session. But there's a custom's office I'd like to have another look at. If you guys don't mind, of course!
HEY! What do you think you're doing here? This area's not safe for civilians.
We're in the middle of an investigation here. Though we have the situation fully under control, we can't be sure if there's still someone at large.
As I said. It's none of your business. So you either vacate this place... Or I'll have to remove you by force.
Not until you've told me where your acting officer is.
I gather there's some kind of disagreement?
Nothing that can't be solved. We're looking for Lieutenant Tanner.
I see. Well, you found him.
So, what's your business with me?
For starters... Mind explaining why you're not at your post?
Drop the pretense. You know exactly who we are and why we're here!
You're a bit early, aren't you?
I don't like to repeat myself.
Yes, yes! I'm very sorry about the delay. And promise I'll be with you as soon as our investigation is concluded.
This is not up for debate. And by the way: You and your men shouldn't be in the demilitarized zone, anyway.

You're right about that. But here we are. And we won't leave until we're finished. You could make a fuss over it, of course. I'm sure there's a lot of people on both sides eagerly waiting for someone to lose his temper. Or two of us could work together like we're supposed to. What's it going to be?
Glad we could come to an agreement. I'll be right back.
I was afraid you were going to say that. As you wish. A word of warning, though... This won't be pretty.
He's got a point. Stay on your toes in there.
You're damn right we are! Here to claim what's ours at last!
Will you stop, for pity's sake?
Not at all! Three vagabonds from afar, it said. Strong-willed heroes, not to be deterred by any force, be it man or nature.
Your point, if you'd be so kind.
What exactly are we witnessing here?
We better get some distance while her mind is someplace else.
It's not me who's trying to enter a peaceful village unannounced!
You bet! The name's Tillian. I'm the deputy leader of Nestville's militia. Now, how about you tell me what's your business here?
You know a man named Heinrich?
Do you have a representative we can talk to?
Yeah. Not sure if anyone's available... But knowing Kris, he's probably still in the council hall. It's the big building at the end of the road.
Back already? How did it go?
You'll be leading us into the city?
Yup. The boat is just a bit west of here.
Hey there! What can I do for you?
Ah, it's you! He's in a meeting right now. And wants me to relay his sincere apologies for the delay.
Excuse me? He knows we're here?

Naturally! I could almost hear Tilian screaming at you from here. You see, when our little enclave isn't arguing about something, we're able to function almost like a proper community would. I mean, we've only been at it for three years –
I get your point. Let's wait... somewhere else.
Oh, it's you again! How's your stay in Nestville so far?
Hey there! What can I do for you?
Ah, it's you! He's already waiting for you in the council hall.

Naturally! I could almost hear Tilian screaming at you from here. You see, when our little enclave isn't arguing about something, we're almost able to function like a proper community would. I mean, we've only been at it for three years –
Well, I'll inform the councillor right away.
It would be rude to refuse, right?
Precisely! Just give me a second, I'll set the table.
I'm afraid it's still a no.
Oh, excuse me! I didn't hear you come in. Can I help you, by any chance?
Sorry for intruding. We were having a look around... And apparently, some of us can't resist the scent of a freshly cooked meal.
Here's a thought! Why don't the three of you sit down and have dinner with me?
But you came here looking for something, didn't you?
And you think we've just stumbled into the right place?
You never know! Well? Great! Just give me a second, I'll set the table right away!
I'm sorry. Your offer is very kind. But we have to be somewhere.
I see! Don't worry about it! You're always welcome!
I'll get straight to the point. Heinrich sent you, from what I heard. And while I'm glad he had someone to speak with... It also means that the matter is serious.
You've heard what's happening at the checkpoint?
Bits and pieces of it. Though we're trying our best not to get involved. And yet, you're here.
Well then... What can I do for you?
We need to enter Trachi. Today.
What makes you think I can help you with that?
Does the name Julius Gaston ring any bells?
Don't play dumb with me. I know he's one of your people.
Last time we saw him, he was about to get maimed.
Yeah. He's likely still being questioned. But we can get him out, if you want.
There's someone I want you to take with you. Call it insurance.
You've met him, already. It's Tillian.
I see. Alright. We'll do as proposed.
Glad we could come to an agreement. There's a small waterway, just west of this village. Tillian will show you the way. Present this to the person watching the boat.
There's a maintenance access at the northern partition of the wall. It leads straight into the eastern sewer network. The entrance itself is guarded by a set of two Guardsmen.
When does the night shift usually take over?

These are the records of the last two weeks. Though there's a high chance they've changed it, after what happened today. But seeing as that likelihood will only increase... You might as well give it a shot.
Now, if you'll excuse me, I've got to get back to work. Best of luck to you.
One more thing. I hope I'm not adding more fuel to the fire by helping you.
We'll see about that. Until next time.
It doesn't matter. As you can see, your councillor granted us passage.
Hm. Looks legit to me. Wish I could say the same about you.
Whatever the case might be... We really need to get going now.
Don't let me keep you, then.
We're not inside the city yet.
Considering our track record... We're about to get hit by a lightning strike.
Then let's move, before it catches up to us.
Aren't we supposed to go from west to east?
Just don't forget to check your corners.
I'm terribly sorry! This has to be a mistake!
Calm down. It's just a routine inspection. Mind if we come in?
HEY! Not dozing off in the middle of a mission, are we? Seriously...
Like there's a point in rushing things... This place is cordoned off, anyway.
Whatever you say~ But can we at least take shelter somewhere? It's pouring like crazy, if you haven't noticed!
Yeah. Let's keep checking those houses.
I know I shouldn't be asking this.
You knew that guy, didn't you?
Overheard, more like. He screamed his lungs out, if you hadn't noticed.
The window! I'll go after him.
I don't think splitting up is a good idea. But we don't really have a choice.
Right. I'll be back in a second.
Might as well use the chance.
Yup. Couldn't find a damn thing back there. A few scraps of cloth, and a bit of blood. But nothing else.
Doesn't matter. We got what we came for.
Yup. Let's head back and report.
Of all the people. Are you alone?
Yeah. And you know that I won't cooperate.

Atlas... Do you remember the day I recruited you? I knew you'd be good at this. But I was sure that someone like you... Someone who has suffered through so much, himself. Would understand that people like us can't help but create misery. It's true... Most of us hate ourselves for the things we do. But you... Are made up of something else, entirely. I don't know what drives you, exactly. But during those ten years I worked for EnKAD... I've never seen anyone enjoy it half as much as you do.

I'm going to state this for the sake of completeness... Your name is Daniil Preston. Former deputy to the chairman of the Ionian Revolutionary Comittee. Now acting ringleader of the self- proclaimed Free People's Syndicate. Four days ago, your men seized a shipment from Kenović central station. Where did you take it? I don't want to repeat myself.
Would be a waste of breath, anyways.
You of all people should be aware -
I wouldn't stall if I were you. Time isn't on your side.
Thirty minutes until we start on the thumbs. Do you really want to know what's going to happen after that? I'm going to need an answer, soon.
You're not going to get one.
What- No... NO! Not her as well! She's a child, damn you!
You're right. It doesn't matter, anymore. Silk Street 32.
Save it. You'll take care of them?
Good. Go ahead, then. Don't let a dead man keep you. Do it, you coward!
I read your report. A shame it's come to this. But Hyperion wanted you there.
For what it's worth, he's very pleased with the outcome. And I think you're in for a promotion. I'm sorry Atlas.
No need for that. Daniil knew what he signed up for.
Right. And let's not forget... That you've saved a countless number of lives. The grain is being prepared for shipment to Hermin, as we speak. Atlas... If you're concerned about Dorothy-
As well as you might expect. She's a tough girl. But I doubt she'll ever forgive me.
I see. I don't think I ever told you, by the way... Hyperion wants to recruit her.
What?! No fucking way! I won't let it happen.
You know how he is... Once he's got his eye on someone-
ATLAS! Do you remember... How I tried to keep Lorna out? That didn't go very well, did it?
Yeah. And while we're on that topic... You need to talk to her. Soon.
I don't think this is the time nor the place.
I'm serious, Eury. And so is she.
I'm not a diplomat, mind you.
I know. You're not going there to hammer out terms... But to enforce them.
You said it'd be up to me.
It is. But I'd like to hear a reason, at least.
It's simple, really. You're trying to bullshit me.
Both of us know you could send anybody. So I'm guessing... There's something else.
In any case. If that's all... I'll go and catch up on some sleep.
Atlas. You ever wondered what happened to Eurydice?
If you're trying to guilt-trip me into this-
I'm not falling for that again. And you shouldn't, either.
And you want me to make sure it's her?
The embassy is in Gharten Street, northwest of Trenton Plaza.
Yup. As long as his wife is safe, he'll do any- thing.
But in the meantime... We should focus on dealing with two issues. First, the Tanner situation. We know far too litle of him.
What do you know him, then?
Not much. He's a founding member of the Republican Guard. Used to be a mobster. But Faber managed to mobilize him for his cause.
And so he brought him into the Guard?
Yup. He's his patron, so to speak. Of course, not everyone is happy about that. There's also the "old Guard". People from Amryn's former garrison.
I see... Neither of them sound particularly sympathetic to me.

Right. In any case... We have a contact inside the eastern prefecture. And enough men at his disposal to safeguard our bridgehead. Just in case something goes wrong, of course. Regardless, he agreed to a meeting.
And you want one of us, to go?

In his office. And then there's also Amryn to deal with. For this reason, we've activated one of our assetts in the administration. The administrator of Filmore, to be precise. He's agreed to facilitate a meeting with Faber, this evening. At his house in Filmore Avenue. I'll need the two of you to prepare his house for our hit. Daphne.
You'll take care of the upper level, including our man, himself.

Ganymede, on the other hand... At the same time, Ganymede will stake out the ground floor... And make sure that his wife won't get in the way. She doesn't know about any of this, according to him... So try to be on your best behaviour.
Alright. Just keep her busy, then?
Exactly. Let Daphne handle the rest.
I have a bad feeling about this. ...
This has to be a trap.
I don't think we have a lot of options. This might be our last shot to get him.
Wandering like that into the lion's den, though? Let me call for backup, at the very least.
We don't have time for that. If you don't want to come, I can understand that.
You know I'm not allowed to leave you out of my sight.
Well, in that case... We should get underway.
Beats me. Seems that way. Well, he certainly lives up to his reputation. But at least he's handed over our papers.
Yeah, I'm good to go. Thanks for saving me back there.
Don't worry about it. How did your survey go?
Not much to see outside of the ordinary. But you can definitely feel the tension in the air. Also overheard people talking about something in the like of a lockdown, apparently.
I heard the same. But I guess we'll have to see what happens. Apparently, Amryn has also heavily increased their presence within the city.
It's hard to tell. But I intend to find out. Have you been to Gharten Street, yet?
Nope. It's west of here, isn't it?
Yeah. Just cross one of the bridges, and orient yourself northwest of Trenton Plaza.
Once you're there, you should see a big, old-style building to your right. That's the Amrynian embassy. I want you to keep a watch over that place. And make note of anyone entering or leaving it.
I have some business to take care of.
What about our man in the parliament?
He's at odds with Faber, from what I know.
Maybe. I'd rather not activate him, so soon. Let's give him until tomorrow.
Not sure how to say this...
He's an oddity, alright. But I wouldn't underestimate him.
Doesn't the same go for yourself?
It's just... I can't put my finger on it. But something about him is seriously off.
Listen... I don't know what you're trying to do here. But I'd focus on my objectives, if I were you. And I'm not saying this for my sake. Hyperion doesn't appreciate detours. Take it from me.
I'm doing what can to the best of my abilities, no?
A bit harsh, but I'll take it.
That's not what I mean. There's gotta be something.
You know what I'm referring to.
I'm sure he's already told you everything you need to know. Or maybe not. Because otherwise you wouldn't be here, right?
It's because of her, isn't it?
So why didn't you turn her in?
Are you sure you can do this?
She used to be your handler, didn't she? That business with her sister...
I'm just trying to understand... Your relationship to someone who has been AWOL for almost two years.
We parted ways long before that.
Until she disappeared. And you were sent to find her. So again... Why didn't you turn her in?
Remember what you said earlier? About her sister and me? I have to keep an eye on Eury... Because I owe it to her.
He went to the custom's office, but I lost him in there.
I see. If Amryn has someone in the administration, it could be problematic.
We'll have to make find out who's on our side, first. Can you deliver a message for me?
There's a wine trader in Clarin square. Ask him for a Chariot 1896. And give him this.
And while you're there... Would you mind keeping an eye on the custom's office after you're done?
Good. I'll see you later, then.
I was wondering when you'd show up again.
It's been a busy couple of days. How's Ganymede?
Is he on his way back, already?
Not sure. He was still around when I left. But I'd assume he'll leave soon.
Did you manage to find her?
Yup. She's even younger than I expected.
Yeah. Told me the entire story.
Alright. Should we go and see Tanner, then?
I would say so. You know where he lives?
Corner house in Farblein Trail. Second floor.
Good. Then let's get it over with.
A bunch of numbers. Let me think... 9799... 2345... 7542. Can you make anything of it?
I'm not sure. It's been a while since we've gotten hold on one of their books. But I'll check it out. Did you see who's on the other side?
Yeah! He went into that house over there.
So I might as well keep watch from up here.
I see. Don't let me keep you, then.
Oh, I almost forgot. I came across Tillian.
Is that so? Anything important he had to say?
Not really... But it made me remember something. That councillor we met in Nestville...
He used to be the administrator of Rondham, until last year.

Shortly after Trachi declared its independence, there was a heated discussion on how to handle citizenship. Rondham has always harboured a lot of Ionians, among other foreigners. As you know, the provisionary parliament decided to make Trachian citizenship exclusive. In other words, a lot of Ionians had to either relinquish their original citizenship... Or pack their things and leave. Naturally, Ionia wasn't exactly pleased about that. So they tried to kill that motion.
Yup. Mainly because Faber backed it. Most foreigners in Trachi didn't care much about it. But some of them decided to return to their home country. Others went to the DMZ and founded Nestville.
He lost a significiant part of his electoral base. And was unseated by another candidate during last year's election.
I see. Can I ask you something?
Our little detour through Nestville... Was that planned?
What do you mean by that?

Well... To me, it looks like we've just followed a script. The chicanery at the checkpoint... And it just so happens that there's this village, nearby. You can't tell me that the option wasn't on the table.
If that were the case, we could've saved ourselves a lot of time if we just went there, directly.
But we needed to keep up the facade. We're not really here to negotiate. Are we?
Depends on who you're asking. But as far as Faber is concerned... We don't expect him to cooperate.
So we're gearing up for war?
Not if we can prevent it. Which is why we should keep our eyes on what's in front of us.
Right! I totally forgot about that! Thanks, though.
Both of them had brown hair. The man was slightly shorter than the woman. He had crimson eyes, hers were deep emerald.
When was the last time you saw them?
No. He left first, the woman a couple of hours afterwards.
Did they say anything to you?
Anybody else asked you any questions about them?
Alright. Thank you very much for your cooperation.
Good morning, Sir! How can I help you?
What's the meaning of this? Who are you?
You know who I am. Don't try to play games with me.
More importantly... Would you mind explaining yourself?
You know perfectly well what I'm talking about.
... I'm sorry. But I had to do something. I received a facsimile from Amryn's ambassador, yesterday. They know about our arrangement. I had to prove that there wasn't any truth to it.
It's not what we agreed on.
That's open to interpretation. You made it in, after all. Didn't you?
Mr. Faber... I'm not here to discuss details. The matter of the fact is... You brought this situation on yourself. And we need to resolve it.
For one... We haven't received our papers.
Thank you. That matter being settled... Your ploy lost us about half a day. We'll need extended access to make up for it.
Well, in that case... I'll have to refuse.
Mr. Faber... I thought a man of your rank would realize the situation he's been put into.
Oh – I understand perfectly! You think you can intimidate me! But you're not in Ionia, anymore.
That's not the point. The only thing that matters is whether you accept our terms or not.
You'll have to reimburse. Or we'll take this city by force.
I could have you arrested on the spot for saying that.

Are you listening to me? Whether it's me, or someone else you're having this conversation with... Is irrelevant. And if I'm compromised... So are you. One thing's for certain, though. We will take our share. Through you, or someone else.
Well, we'll see about that. In any case... I'll need some time to think this over.
You have until six o'clock. Thank you for your time.
Is there something you'd like to tell me?
Jesus... Do you think I'm stupid?
Then how about you tell me what the fuck's going on? We're not going to that dam, are we?
Because the entire thing with Fredrick Dam is nothing but a hoax. And I won't let you die for something stupid like that.
Thanks, I guess... But that doesn't answer my question.
Right. The reason we're going to Calpoli... Is because it's the least guarded checkpoint of our border to Amryn.
So what are we supposed to do there?
Atlas... Stop speaking in riddles, already!
I know you want to run away. Hell, I think everybody does, at this point.
So that's what it's all about? You want to get me out?
Of course not. That's why I said... It's up to you.
Are we just gonna stare at each other the entire trip?
You feel like there's something we should talk about?
I'm not sure. But the silence is killing me.
Yeah... So... Have you made up your mind, yet?
Sometimes you really are an idiot.
What do you mean by that?
Who are you doing this for?
I'm doing this for me. Because if I didn't... I'd hate myself.
So you're guilt-tripping yourself into this?
I'm not one to judge. Thanks, though.
In any case... I'm grateful. Because you trying to prove a point... Means I get to spend more time with you.
You could at least look at me, you know.
I thought you wanted to ask me something.
Does she know about our trip?
What do you mean by that?
Won't she be worried? Last time we spoke.... Didn't go very well. I'd hate for her to be kept in the dark for too long. And yeah, I know... It's safer if she doesn't know.
That's not the primary reason. Your sister is more than able to take care of herself, I have no doubt about that.
Why keep it from her, then?

You of all people should know... That she'd never let you go. Not because her career and life are on the line. To be perfectly honest, she doesn't really care about herself a lot. But you, on the other hand? She would give everything just to keep you safe.
That doesn't make sense. There's no way I would have let her stop me.
I doubt any of us would have been able to. But as I said... She's prepared to take the fall for you. The place you're headed, however... She won't be able to protect you there.
You can't really blame her. After all, you are a bit of a troublemaker.
I'm sorry. But there's people who won't accept tyranny. No matter what it calls itself. I don't know how you can bear it. But I guess every trait has it's value at some point.
I'll take that as a compliment.
I can't help it. I owe it to Eury.
It always come back to her, doesn't it?
Not for much longer. Once you've crossed the border, you'll have to become a different person entirely.
I know. It's a one-way trip...
You can still turn back, you know?
Nope. I've made up my mind. Besides, you never know... Perhaps one day I'll return.
You'd put all of us in danger.

That's not what I mean. I am talking about an Ionia that is free. And I know you can see it, too. You and my sister can go on and on about duty as much as you like. But both of you have long realized that you're playing a farce. This system can't be changed from the top. Not behind closed doors. And not on the whim of a man whose only redeeming quality is to be victor of a power struggle.
We've been over that a thousand times already. You were talking about values earlier, remember? There's value in recognizing that you've lost. In the end, we're just trying to survive.
Time to make up your mind. So... What's it gonna be? Damn, you really are indecisive.
What tells you that I haven't made up my mind already, long ago?
Sorry about the disturbance. Would you mind showing me your identification, please?
Of course! Can never be to sure in these trying times, eh?
Hm... I'm afraid I must ask you to come with me.
Yes, I've been informed of that.
Because of who you're working for.
If you're implying that it's me...
That's not what I meant. Between the three of us, you're the outsider. And you've been out cold the entire morning, let's not forget.
East: Eastern Checkpoint South: Old Admirality West: Hudsman Corner
We should finish our business here, first.
We have an appointment with Mr. Werter. Here's our invitation.
Just a couple of questions about Dad... He's done something bad, hasn't he? Is that why you're here?
Don't worry. I'm not here to question you. On the contrary... I'm the one who's got a confession to make.
It's okay. Not that I mind... But are you sure meeting like this is a good idea?
The more obvious the better. We're at war now.
Don't worry. We're ready. Thanks to you.
For the record... It wasn't my-
Good. Anyways... We better get going.
It's been three days, already, hm.
Yeah. Before we go... There's something I've got to tell you.
Sorry. But I already waited eight agonizing years. You know that I love you, right?
You never asked yourself why I'm so fiercely loyal to you?
Because it's part of your job?
Sorry. But I don't believe it.
You think I'd make this up?
I'm not questioning your love... But your loyalty.
Right. Very good, actually. Let me rephrase the question, then. Why do you think I haven't killed you, yet?
Do you want to kill me?
Because of what I did to Daniil?
And because you sold me and my mother out.
If it's an apology you want-
What? Why would you think that?
I don't know what you're talking about.
Cut the bullshit! You told Eury about arteria, didn't you?
Of course I did. Just like you ordered me to.
Right. Somehow, this information ended up with Amryn. Now, how did that happen, I wonder?
I'm sure you'll tell me in a second.
As it stands, there are two possibilities. They either got it from Eury... Or you. So? Which do you think it is?
Hm. I'm quite baffled that you of all people would ask me that question. Seeing as you were the one who brought her to me.
To watch her, yeah. Tell me, then... Where is she?
Sorry, Daph. But I had to make sure.

You asked me why I didn't turn Eury in, right? n<AtlasIt's true. I have to protect her. But not from us. Pravoskos told you, didn't he? We needed to put up a show for Eury. So she could get close to Lorentz.
Not yet. But they've set up a meeting.
And you think he's really here?
He has to be. His fingerprints are all over Amryn's movements Including Ganymede.
Yeah. You were right about him.
He really was working for Lorentz, then?
All the signs are pointing to it.
A shame. He's a very bright young man.
Some people can't be trusted, I guess.
Right. You want to send him back?
Yeah. It was fun, while it lasted... But I already got what I wanted from him.
Alright. I'll file the papers once we get back.
Okay. Something still bothers me, though.
You really think that's going to work?
Sorry. Old habits die hard, I guess.
Come on, Atlas. I know you're tired and all. But I really can't take it anymore!
Right. Let's get this over with.
Yup. We got him cornered. The kill is yours.
There should be a patrol passing through here, any minute.
See that door to your right? There's a maintenance area in there.
Sorry to keep you waiting. He put up more resistance than I thought.
Don't worry about it. How is he?
There's one thing that worries me, though.
I checked for his keys... But they were gone, already.
You got your own set of keys with you?
Good. Let's not waste any more time, then.
You know your way through the sewers?
Yeah. I've taken that route a few times, before.
Okay. I'll stay here and keep an eye on Drenem. Good luck to you!
Are you absolutely sure this'll work?
Holding onto something for that long... You know how they are.
Yeah. If you want me to go, instead... I'll do it.
That's no good. Your boss wouldn't let you go. Not for anything in the world. No. It's gotta be me.
I'm sorry, Gany. If you want out... I won't hold it against you.
Don't mock me, please. I'd never forgive myself. And you know that.
I wish there was a way I could make it easier on you.
Well... Give me a reason to hold out. Make it worth it.
