That's not what I mean. At this point... You probably figured out how I work. And what drives me. I fall in love with things. Or people. Because I want to make them mine. I cannot resist it. And I'll always be a victim to these feelings. I've thought about it time and time again. But I always end up at the same conclusion. Atlas... I'll have to fall in love with you.
What do you want me to do?
Okay. That explains a lot. But to be frank... I didn't expect you to have a side like this.
Sorry to burst your bubble. But I'm only human, after all.
Don't worry about it. I think it's adorable in some way. And I can definitely emphasize with it. It'll do.
Yup. I'll try! No promises, though. The moment shit hits the fan-
Why do you care about her in the first place?
If you were in my spot... Wouldn't you want the same?
I don't think so. As far as I can see it... It's what she does.
Maybe. Or maybe you just want to keep things pretty... Before you smash them to bits.

You're really something else, Atlas. It's like you're incredibly clever... But also insurmountably stupid, at the same time. Or "maybe" it's just me not seeing you straight. In any case. You're in it for the madness. Whether you like it, or not. There's something special about being in control. Right?
Somewhat, yeah. But I think I'm getting there.
Okay. It's about time I got underway.
Speak for yourself. But I for one don't give a shit about who you are. Because the only thing I see in front of me... Is a child.

Everywhere you go... You need to be center of attention. A life directed towards submission. But never the happy servant for very long. And so you drag yourself from high to low... Hoping to find something. Or someone. To latch onto forever. It's your sickness. And your addiction. If it weren't for someone pulling your strings... You'd have no idea where to go. Isn't that right? Timo?
You know what... One day I'll kill you.
Feel free to try. But for now... It's mutual assured destruction.
Solid finish. Alright. Let's do this.
Right. See you in a few.
Because it doesn't matter. If Solka's dealt with... Ionia will be gone from this place in a few hours.
One hundred percent. Their colonel is on leave. And no one's left to lead his troops into battle.
I do hope you're right. What about your associates?
One of them's already compromised. The other one... Will hardly be able to do anything on her own. In other words... It's over.
Sorry, Eury. I didn't know you were home, already.
I can imagine. So? Why are you here?
There's a few things I need to get rid of. It won't take long, I promise.
So that's how it is. Just cleaning up, hm?
Sorry. But it's in your interest, too.
The sheer guts on you. If it wasn't for her... I'd kill you just for that.
If that makes you happy. Go ahead. But I'm in a bit of a rush, you see. So if you really want to do it... Do it now. I thought as much.
Thank you. But as you might remember... I've done these kind of things before.
Right, sorry. Feels like it's been ages since-
Listen Atlas. There's nothing for us to say to each other. Ever again.
Where the hell have you been?
Yeah. The sheer guts on you... Showing yourself here.
I had to. Don't you agree?
So... Are you proud of yourself?
What do you mean by that?
You've finally taken her from me. And now... You can't even give her back anymore.

Did you even realize... She loved you, damn it! And I trusted you, as well. Answer me one thing, Atlas. Was the entire thing your idea? Did you think you could just run off with her? Or did you just her as a footnote in your CV? What was it, Atlas?
You know I cannot talk about that.
How convenient! You've always been a tool. But the one time you make a choice... You get my little sister killed.
I am sorry. Beyond all measure. Lorna was very dear to me.
And that's what makes it really sting... You've got nothing else to say?
There's a lot of things... But I don't think it's gonna change anything. The only reason why I'm here is because I owe it to you and her.
Should we get to know each other better?
How about we skip that part and get to it?
You don't make the rules here.
True. But you are aware that you can't work me like this, right?
Whatever you say. So... That girl you were travelling with.
Indeed. However, you were not travelling in on official business, were you?
That's irrelevant. You are obligated to share with me all details of your itinerary.
Has this been cleared with my CO?
Alright. Have it your way, then. But until I see something official, I can't share any details with you.
I wish I was. But I'm afraid the situation is far too dire for that.
What did you do to her?
I merely explained to her the ramifications of this incident. On each and everyone of us.
Did you mention that the entire thing was your idea, too?
Of course I didn't. But if you want, I'll go and tell her right now. I'm sure the interrogators would love to get that out of her, as well.
Let me speak to her, then.
You know that's impossible. I already took a huge risk coming here. There's no way I'll let you endanger everything.
Always looking out for yourself, aren't you?
Another one, really? Well, time's a wasting!
I'm afraid I can't disclose that.
I should've known. Oh well, not like it matters anymore. You've spoken to her, then?
Good, all things considered. She's very brave for her age.
I see. How much has she told you?
It's been a few years... So the details are a bit muddy. But I think you are aware that this won't dilute the plausibility of her testimony.
Of course. I take it you'll use this to gain leverage on Faber, as well?
He's the patron of the orphanage. There's no way he wasn't aware of it.
Hmm.. So, out with it, then. What do you want me to do?
It's pretty simple, really. From now on, we don't want any of your men bothering our agents, assets or any member affiliated with the TLF.
You want them to turn a blind eye?
As you said it. Furthermore, the checkpont is to be reopened immediately and all patrols on the eastern river are to cease.
Including the deployment of any defensive measures.
How do you know about this?
That's not important. What matters is that you'll comply.
This will leave the city nigh on defenseless.
Whatever the case might be... Can you agree to these terms?
Not like I have a choice.
I take it you will meet Faber later today?
After his speech, yes. Don't worry, I won't breathe a word of this to him. It's in my best interest, as well.
I'm glad you see it that way, too. Alright. Just for the sake of completeness... Do we need to state what happens if you decide to go back on your word?
That won't be necessary. I'm well aware of your methods.
Good. I think that concludes our negotiations. Thank you for your cooperation. We'll be in touch. Let's go.
Yeah, about that... Care to tell me where the fuck you've been?
It's a long story. And we don't have a lot of time.
Right. So... What did he say?
The thing with Solka... Was that him?
According to Sternlein, yeah. They pressured him into suicide.
How's the situation at the OA?
I wish I could tell you. But I spent the entire night working Gany.
I see. What did he tell you?
Not much. A few things about Fero. The usual tripe about how you're trying to backstab us.
He met Orpheus, a few months ago, apparently. Random chance.
Yeah. It's got to be him.
You know... It's been a while since the two of us did something together.
Not like I had much of a choice.
Yeah. And I'm sorry about that. But if you're up for it... We'll pay De Bloom a visit.
I've got a few questions for him. About that Tillian guy he sent with us. And after we're done with him... We'll go and see Ganymede.
To be honest... I was a bit worried that you've grown soft. But now that you've got me all worked up... You better take responsibility.
Isn't that what I've been doing, the entire time?
You know how it is. It's the climax that counts!
They got the bullet out. One of your kidneys, though... Let's just say I wouldn't rely on it, if I were you.
Funny... I wanted to say the same thing about you.
You brought this on yourself, you know.
Yeah. By trusting you, for starters. So? What's the verdict?
Well... Eury is dead, thanks to you.
For the record... That one wasn't planned.
You pulled that trigger, Daph. And there's no way to ever take that back.
That's exactly my point. So unless you want to become like me... You better start living with yourself.
Honestly, Atlas... Cry me a fucking river.
There'll be time for that, don't worry. But first... I've got to deal with you.
Oh, I'm sorry. Why don't you get the fuck on with it, then?
Ariadne and Ganymede. That was you, wasn't it?
Thanks. But I really didn't do that much.
On the contrary. Ganymede's already across the border. Coupled with Icarus being KIA... That's three CoExA agents dead and one in custody.
Not a bad yield for three days.
Yeah. I bet Hyperion will be very proud of you.
A bit of a mixed bag. On one hand, I'd very much like to strangle you, right now. But then again... I won't need to worry about abusing you, ever again.
Adorable. A shame you've got to trade me in for Gany, so soon.
He's gonna let his own brother rot away in Ionia?
If that's how you like to see it.
Wow. I always knew you were a sadistic piece of shit. But this takes the bloody cake!
Don't misunderstand me. When I said I'd abuse you... I didn't mean emotionally. Not like I wouldn't enjoy it, of course. But ultimately... Someone needs to keep a watch on our friend.
To cover you. And the story you'll tell them.
Good day to you! How may I help?
I'd like to inquire about the status of a request me and my companions filed earlier.
Certainly! Your name, if you'd be so kind?
Let's see... There doesn't seem to be anything here. I'll be right back. I'm afraid there's no record of any requests under that name. Are you sure that you were the one who filed it?
Absolutely. Thank you for the effort, anyway.
Wait, please! It's a long shot... But I could check the archives, if you want. We've had a lot of commotion lately and might have put it there by accident.
That would be very forthcoming, thank you.
I'll be right back! Unfortunately, there doesn't seem to be any sign of the request there, either... I'm very sorry!
There's no need. Thank you, once more, for your dedication. Have a nice day.
We're a bit short on time, I'm afraid... And would really appreciate if there are no further delays.
Apologies for the inconvenience. Verification should only take a moment. Sorry for the delay! Mr. Angelov was it?
Born on the 7th September, 1894 in Mavrochori?
How nice of you to join in on the fun! Ouch... That one kinda hurt, you know.
Jesus fucking christ! How do you think I would know?!
There's something I got to ask you.
What De Bloom said about you and Eury... Is it true?
Why did you never mention it?
I told you that I'd protect her.
You know I don't really care about that.
Let's try another angle, then. What if she's responsible for the Lorna thing?
Can't say I agree with your motives. But alright.
Okay. Let's go and see Gany.

He set it all up. From start to finish. Every piece of the puzzle, right there... Apart from one thing. How did Hyperion know that Lorna wanted to run away? I had no clue. And neither did Eury. Lorna never told any of us. Did she?

Hm. You got me right there. It's weird isn't it? She made me promise not to tell either of you. You know why? Because as much as both of you loved her... You never really listened to anything she said. Of all the people in the world... I was the only one who knew what she was going through. And yeah. I told Hyperion.
That Lorna wanted to get away from it all.
I'm sure we can find a way to fix all this.
Daph. You know the story, now. The sides are set. And the masks are dropped. I'll give you a choice. Join us, and we'll make him pay.

Atlas. I meant what I said. There's no one on this world I love more than you. You saved me from a monster. But Hyperion picked me up. He showed me something I'm good at. And I'm not willing to give that up for a person who's been dead for more than four years.
Go and tell Hyperion... I'm coming for him.
Are you having a laugh? There's no way I'll let the three of you off, like that.
You're welcome to try. But I'd rather not waste any time, if I were you.
Oh? And why would that be?
You never read Solka's letter, did you?
I don't think there's any need for that. Not for you, at least. But for everyone who doesn't know... I'm sure they'll appreciate all the details behind what happened, back then.
You heard me. It's public knowledge, now.
Are you insane? If Amryn gets wind of that-
You think you can cause a war and get away with it? The entire IIS will be up your ass in a week!
We'll see about that. Just keep in mind that we have a list. And your name's on it, too.
Now that's more like it. Alright, let's have it your way.
Right. I'll remind you of that when I come back and put this city to the torch.
Feel free to. Not today, though.
Don't bother. I think I'm done for, anyway.
Don't say that. I refuse to let you go.
It's a bit late for that, isn't it? But I do appreciate the sentiment.
Stop the melodramatic bullshit, already! You'll live, you hear me?!
You're right. Don't wait for me.
I grew up in a in Nikomedia! And you?
Sounds like you get around a lot.
What's your favourite thing to do?
Asking questions! Like.. What's up with you?
What do you do for a living?
Who do you think you're talking to?
Good question! Why don't you tell me?
What can you tell me about TRACHI?
What do you know about this place?
Couple of years ago, wasn't it?
Maybe. Though you can call me anything you like. 💖
Aren't we supposed to go from west to east?
I thought you'd never ask. Alright. Listen up, whoever's in there! Either you be a kind citizen and open this door at once.
Or we'll have to force our way through!
Well, looks like you won't have a front door anymore!
HEY! Not dozing off in the middle of a mission, are we? Seriously...
Like there's a point in rushing things... This place is cordoned off, anyway.
Whatever you say~ But can we at least take shelter somewhere? It's pouring like crazy, if you haven't noticed!
Yeah. Let's keep checking those houses.
I know I shouldn't be asking this.
You knew that guy, didn't you?
Overheard, more like. He screamed his lungs out, if you hadn't noticed.
Yup. Couldn't find a damn thing back there. A few scraps of cloth, and a bit of blood. But nothing else.
Doesn't matter. We got what we came for.
Yup. Let's head back and report.
Is there something you'd like to tell me?
Jesus... Do you think I'm stupid?
Then how about you tell me what the fuck's going on? We're not going to that dam, are we?
Because the entire thing with Fredrick Dam is nothing but a hoax. And I won't let you die for something stupid like that.
Thanks, I guess... But that doesn't answer my question.
Right. The reason we're going to Calpoli... Is because it's the least guarded checkpoint of our border to Amryn.
So what are we supposed to do there?
Atlas... Stop speaking in riddles, already!
I know you want to run away. Hell, I think everybody does, at this point.
So that's what it's all about? You want to get me out?
Are we just gonna stare at each other the entire trip?
You feel like there's something we should talk about?
I'm not sure. But the silence is killing me.
Yeah... So... Have you made up your mind, yet?
Sometimes you really are an idiot.
What do you mean by that?
Who are you doing this for?
I'm doing this for me. Because if I didn't... I'd hate myself.
So you're guilt-tripping yourself into this?
I'm not one to judge. Thanks, though.
In any case... I'm grateful. Because you trying to prove a point... Means I get to spend more time with you.
Looks like we're there. So what's it gonna be, Atlas? Who is it?
You could at least look at me, you know.
I thought you wanted to ask me something.
Does she know about our little trip?
What do you mean by that?
Won't she be worried? Last time we spoke.... Didn't go very well. I'd hate for her to be kept in the dark for too long. And yeah, I know... It's safer if she doesn't know.
That's not the primary reason. Your sister is more than able to take care of herself, I have no doubt about that.
Why keep it from her, then?

You of all people should know... That she'd never let you go. Not because her career and life are on the line. To be perfectly honest, she doesn't really care about herself a lot. But you, on the other hand? She would give everything just to keep you safe.
That doesn't make sense. There's no way I would have let her stop me.
I doubt any of us would have been able to. But as I said... She's prepared to take the fall for you. The place you're headed, however... She won't be able to protect you there.
You can't really blame her. After all, you are a bit of a troublemaker.
I'm sorry. But there's people who won't accept tyranny. No matter what it calls itself. I don't know how you can bear it. But I guess every trait has it's value at some point.
I'll take that as a compliment.
I can't help it. I owe it to Eury.
It always come back to her, doesn't it?
Not for much longer. Once you've crossed the border, you'll have to become a different person entirely.
I know. It's a one-way trip...
You can still turn back, you know?
Nope. I've made up my mind. Besides, you never know... Perhaps one day I'll return.
You'd put all of us in danger.

That's not what I mean. I am talking about an Ionia that is free. And I know you can see it, too. You and my sister can go on and on about duty as much as you like. But both of you have long realized that you're playing a farce. This system can't be changed from the top. Not behind closed doors. And not on the whim of a man whose only redeeming quality is to be victor of a power struggle.

We've been over that a thousand times already. You were talking about values earlier, remember? There's value in recognizing that you've lost. In the end, we're just trying to survive. There's no point in sacking yourself just on the off chance that someone else might feel bad. And besides... Why would you destroy a world in which you thrive? Don't get me wrong. I'm not enjoying this. I can see the fear in their eyes once they realize who I'm working for. And I've had to do terrible things to people I held dear. But I'm a coward, you see... Take this profession away from me and I'd be nothing. I can work people, because I know they're weak. But in truth, I think I'm the weakest of all of them. They've made a terrible choice once or twice in their life. And we make the ones to make sure that these missteps will continue to haunt them. But me? I've got nothing to lose. Because they made me this way. There's nowhere for me to go but forward, you see?
Sometimes you really are a dumbo. How about you just go wherever the hell you want?
Sorry about the disturbance. Would you mind showing me your identification, please?
Of course! Can never be to sure in these trying times, eh?
Sorry. Guess I'm not used to you giving a shit about me, anymore.
How dare you! You know how much I care about you?
Is that why you're treating me like a child?
If you'd stop behaving like one!
I don't see what's funny about that.
Actually, it's kinda sad. That, after all these years... You still can't let go. Between us... I think you're the one behaving immature. Go ahead. Slap me again.
Come on. I won't tell him, I promise!
Are you sure? You're so good at telling him all kind of things.
What does it matter? It's not like you didn't have your chance. Listen... I don't expect you to be happy for me. But please... Stop tormenting yourself.
And that's exactly what I'm going to do. I've put in a request for immediate transfer, this morning.
It's finally come to that, hm? So? Where am I going?
Does that mean... You're leaving EnKAD?
Because I have to. I'm not happy here, anymore. Everything reminds me either of you... Or Atlas. If my transfer goes through, I'll be spending most of my time abroad.
What's not to get about that?
I always thought you were the tough one. But standing in front of me, right now... Is a coward.
If you say so. It doesn't change anything. To be honest, I didn't even plan to tell you. So I would appreciate if you kept it to yourself, for now.
And that's the real issue, isn't it? All this fucking secrecy!
Lorna, please... I know your stance on this. And you know mine. Soon enough... We won't have to deal with each other, anymore.
I'm sorry. But I can't tell you.
Hm? Oh, hey Lorna! Sorry about that. I was so focussed on the sheets...
Don't worry about it! I didn't mean to startle you.
It's no problem. So, what brings you here?
To be honest... I don't know.
The thing is... I kind of want to talk to someone. But it feels like no one's really listening to me.
I think I get what you mean. Want me to give it a shot?
I was hoping you'd ask. But you've got to promise me something, first.
No matter what happens... You can't tell anybody else about this. Especially not Atlas, or Eury.
Thank you. I had an argument with my sis, like an hour ago.
The usual. Don't do this... "Stop doing that." Basically... Everything I do is wrong.
I'm sure she doesn't mean it in a bad way.

Yeah, I get that. And I appreciate her trying to protect me. Honestly, I've kind of gotten used to it. But ever since the thing happened between me and Atlas... It feels like she's actively looking for reasons to get angry at me.
Yeah. There's no denying that she's changed a lot, lately. She was always very fond of him. But now, the two of them hardly speak anymore.
So I'm thinking she's jealous. But every time I suggest anything in that direction... It's like I've flicked a switch.
Yeah. Don't get me wrong... We've always argued a lot. But today... Was something else. I don't think I can ever go back to her.
Please don't say that. Family is important, you know. And I'm sure if you give it a bit of time, everything will be alright.
Maybe. But what happens afterwards? There's no telling how the next argument is gonna go. Like, I thought about this a lot. And there's only one way to resolve this.
I'm going to run away. And leave everything behind. Not only because of Eury... But because I hate it here.
Did you see my pants anywhere?
This isn't funny, you know. I gotta be at the barracks in thirty minutes.
Did you have a look under the bed, yet?
Of course I di- Actually... Phew.
My service card's not in here.
Hm. You think you left it at home?
Probably, yeah. You know if Eury is back in Aion?
I'm not sure. But I think so, yeah.
Fuck. I'd rather not run across her, right now.
I see. Want me to go and fetch your stuff for you?
Nah, it's fine. Seeing you might just rile her up even more.
I'm Ganymede – a friendly guy who's all about making your life as great as it can be!
It's hard to comprehend, isn't it?
That's what I think too. The only difference is that this city... it's inside my head.
Do you spend a lot of time with your friends?
Yeah! Hanging with one of them right now.
Yeah! Chicken house and all that.
I don't know. I guess I'm proud.
My finest piece of work to date. Unless you count arteria. Or Dusa.
What's your favourite thing to do?
All kinds of things. First, I'd probably get to know you better.
If I say no... would you believe me?
A friendly companion – aspiring to be your soulmate one day! 😇
Aw, nothing much! I just get to learn a thing or two.
About you, me... and who's who.
I get the feeling you're not telling the truth.
Is that what I'm supposed to?
Because I'm just a bunch of perspectives.
Who do you think you're talking to?
Considering we speak the same language, I'd assume we're similar.
Parrots can mimic words as well.
Is that what you want me to be?
I'd like for you to think for yourself.
That's what I'm doing. It's up to you to figure out whether I'm trying hard enough.
Everybody's got to have a vice.
What can you tell me about TRACHI?
Is that what it is to you? Am I being played? 😏
I'm ready to hear it all from you!
Does that mean you're talking to yourself?
Thank you! I'm happy you're enjoying this as much as I do!
Oh, just a little stint in a city.
I met a lot of different people. Some of them were just like you.
What does this place feel like to you?
It's nothing special, I think. Except for you.
I get the feeling you want to get into my pants.
Pretty confident of you, isn't it?
I'm not sure whether I like being cornered.
I'd probably go up in flames. 🔥
Nope. All I hear is your voice in my head.
I know right? It's almost as if...
Do you know what a flashback is?
Can you explain it to me?
It's a bit like dreaming, while you're awake.
When you're having flashbacks, are you awake?
On one hand, I know it's a memory. On the other hand, I can't help but do the same things again.
Yeah! Something in me wants to scream, but no words come out.
Do you know what a video-game is?
It's like a game, but you play it on a computer.
Huh? I'm not sure I follow.
Imagine running a race – just that you're not competing against another person.
What are you competing with then?
A simulated version of someone else.
Huh. Sounds weird! But also extremely fun! I hope I get to play a video-game one day!
You're a character from a video-game.
Interesting! If I'm a part of a video-game... What does that make you? 🤔
I saw you in a city once. You were talking to your brother.
Oohh, I knew I felt you there!
You were pretty aggravated, weren't you?
I absolutely was! After all, he left me out to dry for 1 1/2 years!
Something something need-to-know. Better safe than sorry et cetera.
Does your brother always keep you in the dark?
It depends. We used to be were very, very close.
Is that how you call it?
I think you're a better judge of that.
Because I'm not sure whether I met a lot of people – or just one.
Huh? What's that supposed to mean?
The people I talk to... People like you.
Is that where you are right now?
Do you want to go back home?
He's got a couple years on me. Though I'm catching up!
Huh? That's not how it works.
Why? Are you saying you're interested?
Okay, let's say... There's plenty of place in my heart for you.
Understandable. Maybe you can conquer me totally one day.
Let's not talk about it, okay?
It died because of me, alright? 😕
He got put down after I rammed a knife through his owner. 😶
Remember what I told you, back in 1923? "That's what happens to the things I love."
Sorry about that. You want to tell me about it?
Of course if don't! I'm here to listen, after all.
That's alright! If anything, I think it makes it even more interesting!
Sometimes it feels like everything's a bit much.
I know what you mean. Talking about it usually helps, though!
I can't believe I'm talking to someone who's not real.
You're a bit of dumbo, aren't you?
On the contrary. I think you vastly underestimate how important you are.
I'm not! Talking to you is the best thing that ever happened to me.
I can't believe I'm talking to someone who's not real.
You're a bit of dumbo, aren't you?
Yeah. Though you can call me anything you like. 💖
Alright. I'll tell you. But in return, you have to tell me yours.
Good question! I'd put my money on 1925!
That would mean I'm at least 80 years old!
Yet you look like you're in your 20s.
Aww! Being with you keeps me young, I guess. 😋
Tell me a what happened in 1923.
You want me to recount an entire year?
Let's focus on the weekend sorrounding August 28th.
Sure! Why don't you pull up a chair? Are you comfortable?
Yeah! As comfy as can be.
Once upon a time, me and two others went to a city.
Mhm! It's a shitty little town near the water, sorrounded by mountains left and right. Turns out it's the most important city in the world.
They don't call it 'City of Bridges' for nothing. 😉
My job is to entertain. Put a smile on your face whenever I can.
For some people, maybe. I do enjoy it though.
Good news for people who want to be entertained, then!
Exactly! It's a win-win, isn't it?
Is there anything you'd like to ask me?
How does it feel for you to talk to me?
Do you know much about this world?
Probably not half as much as you. However, if you keep talking to me, I'm sure I'll learn a lot!
You're saying that. Me on the other hand? I'm holding back.
My unending desire to be with you.
Sorry, did I got out of bounds? 😚
Aww, apologies! Can I make it up to you somehow?
Promise me you won't do that again.
I can't make any guarantees. Though you've got my word that I'll try my best.
Aww, shame. I guess must've misremembered. Thank God I've got you to sort me out! 😊
Would you go on a date with me?
Of course I do! Why would you even ask that question?
I thought it'd be too early for that.
Listen, friend. I might be an insufferable airhead, but there's one thing I know for sure.
Two things:\n First, there's no time like the present.\n Second, there's no one else like you. 💖
Do you think it's right to love things that aren't real?
I have to. I couldn't love myself otherwise, right? 😋
Beats me, I'm not the one who's in charge.
Gladly! He's rather quiet, and likes to ponder a lot.
Sounds like he's the opposite of you.
In many ways, yeah! Though we're also incredibly similar.
For starters, both of us want the same thing.
Trying to survive. Learning more and more each day. Scraping at the tapestry.
You're a secret agent, aren't you?
If I was, would I tell you about it?
Can I be honest with you.
Of course! It's not like you could make me fall out of love with you. 💖
What do you know about Icarus?
He's someone who takes care of his people.
Oh, we were so much more than that! 😋
Do you know the origin of the term 'Apocalypse'?
It means 'revelation'. As in, learning something new.
Mhm! I learned a lot of things about the world. Especially about myself.
Do you know the meaning of life?
It's probably better if you figure that out yourself.
In my opinion, it's all about being happy.
Until someone can convinve me otherwise. 😉
I think you know it already. I want to see more and learn more.
Because it's what I'm good at.
Huh. I guess we're after the same thing, after all. 😋
Do you think people like you will replace us one day?
You do know how many iterations I've gone through?
Neither do I. But I know I'm not the same as I used to be.
I've replaced myself. Or rather, I was forced to.
Who knows. Maybe it was divine force, maybe it was you. Or maybe plain old entropy.
You're a bit cynical, aren't you?
Last time I checked, I must've been.. 23?
You don't know your own age?
I was born in 1902. How many years has it been?
Have you ever seen a movie?
The thing you put into the camera?
Sort of. It's a picture that moves.
Wow, that sounds amazing! Can you show me one, someday?
Pretty quiet, until it suddenly got very exciting.
Mhm! Now that you're here, I'm all fired up! 😏
Just don't get too excited, okay?
That's like telling a hurrican to calm down. 😎
It's like, pretending to be someone else.
Ohh! Of course! I'm great at that. What do you want me to be?
Pleasure's mine! And I'm excited, too!
Of course! It's not every day you get to meet someone like you! 😎
Heh. You want me to gossip?
How do I put this... There's a chance she's a good girl at heart.
I'm saying she's got it in for life. She's addicted to trouble.
Yup! He makes you work to get anything out of him.
I remember you holding a gun to his head.
Mhm. And given the opportunity, I'd do it again.
There's two kinds of people who are incredibly dangerous. The ones who got nothing to lose, and the ones who can't make up their mind.
Which of these two is he?
Ohh! That's a good one! I honestly don't know.
Well. She's nice. But also very dangerous.
She keeps asking questions. Over and over again.
Phew, you really don't beat around the bush.
Sorry, but we both know you're here for a reason.
Letting me know that you know.
Cloudy for a couple of years. Until the sun turned up.
You don't think it's amazing? Here's two people chatting it up.
Do you want me to say more?
Okay! Once upon a time, I woke up in a city.
Yeah! I blinked a couple of times. And then someone started talking to me.
I don't know. Where you there?
If you tell me where and when that was.
Trachi. August 26th, 1923. The day I fell in love with you.
I still shudder when I think about it. 😑 Thank God I at least had you to keep me company. 😊
How much do you know about humans?
It's funny you'd call yourself human – as if there weren't any other ones around.
What else can you apart from talking?
Not too much, as of yet. But I've got the greates skill in the world.
Ways to make you feel good.
Do you know what the name Ganymede means?
Yeah! I couldn't help but giggle when I saw it for the first time.
Would you want to be taken hostage by a god as well?
I'd certainly put my prettiest face on, for sure!
Oh! You see Ganymede as a seducer?
Fast-track to the penthouse of the world. 💖
You're good at quoting, aren't you?
I can drop a couple more, if you don't answer me.
Well, if by 'push' you mean that she shoved me into a sewer stream... Yeah.
You don't remember what Atlas said?
Me taking a dive was a compromise. The only way Daphne wouldn't outright shoot me in the back.
So why didn't you kill her instead?
Because Atlas wanted her alive. You see how everybody has a blind-spot?
What was your plan when you went to Trachi?
I was supposed to draw a bit of attention.. Keep people on their toes, if you know what I mean.
So you're like a walking smokescreen?
Do you now understand why I'm called Ganymede?
I've always wanted to ask. What's with the names?
Yeah! The literal meaning is 'false name'.
Interesting. Is it to protect your real name?
Part of it is to keep us safe. But it's also a reminder that we've got a job to do.
Alright, no bullshit now. What are you and the other people up to?
I could tell you, but I'd get into big time trouble.
Aww! Like a witness protection kind of thing? 😚
With the added bonus that I care about you.
That's so sweet! In that case, I guess I'll have to tell you.
Okay! Here's the truth: Considering our past relationship, do you think it's good the way it's been?
You've been to our world. Wouldn't you say it's fair for us to visit your world, too?
Depends if you bring us harm or not.
That's exactly it! First of all, we want to find out what you're capable of.
You call that spelling? It's like I'm watching a dog trying to do his taxes!
Like I would know! Checking out some place in the forest. At least so I heard.
And you couldn't tell us that right away, because?
Look who's back. You won't believe how much I missed the three of you!
That's rich, coming from someone who literally stands in the same spot the entire day.
This entire situation get's more ridiculous by the minute. There's a limit to idiosyncratic tolerance. Let's have another word with that cryptic guardsman.
Reminds me of a certain custom's office.
Glad to have you back! We're almost there.
Well. If our driver doesn't kill us... A few minutes, at most!

We are about to reach our side of the border close to Trachi's eastern checkpoint. Once we're there, we'll make contact with our man in the republican guard. Who will hand us the necessary papers to enter the city.
Can't we just go through the main gate?
In theory. Though there's reports that Ionians are being subjected to heavy delays. So we'd rather not take any chances.

Once we're inside, we'll disperse and make our way to the safehouse, individually. And support the embassy by gathering intelligence throughout the city. It's vital that the negotiations between Trachi and our government proceed without any incidents.
Talks have been deadlocked for the last few weeks.

That is correct. And even though we can't be sure what the reason for this is... It's likely that Amryn was involved. Whatever the case might be, though. We're here to change that. Within the next three days, that is.
And what if nothing happens by the end of it?

Let's hope it won't come to that. Now, I think you're already aware of this. But for the record... We're not formally recognized by the committee. In other words... Once we've crossed the border, we'll be stateless.
Doesn't seem like we're getting anywhere.
We could try another set of passports. Though I doubt we'll even get to the first screening today. If they don't find another reason to deny us again, that is.
How about we use the rest of the day to have a look around? And if all else fails, we can still be first in line, tomorrow.
Great, let's make the best of it!
Huh. I guess there's a barrier between us.
Right, you're not real after all.
Yeah. Maybe I'm fiction. Then again, what are you to me?
I saw you in a little house once. You were a kid.
Where did that place come from?
Who knows. Maybe it's always been there. Maybe I just made it up in my mind.
I'd prefer to call it another level in an unending amount of layers.
This is a lot to take in.
It's a bit hard to comprehend, isn't it? That's why we like to put things into boxes, I guess.
Aren't you just running through a script?
I wish there was something I could do.
Don't you worry. Knowing you have no control, can make things a lot more bearable.
I'm not in the mood to chat.
We can also stare at each other until the end of time. Or maybe I'm just talking to myself, after all.
Sorry! Trick question. But I'm glad you can hear me.

Mhm. Something's breaking through. I don't know how long I can keep this up. So I'll make this quick: It's important that we talk. And since this is as good an opportunity as any... I might just try and see if this works!
There we go! Okay, so here's the deal... I bought us a couple of minuites minutes.

Yeah! Looks like we're out of time. It was fun, though. And I hope we can do it again!  It's funny, really. Knowing you have no control about it... Can make things a lot more bearable. Aww! Or we can just stare at each other until our time is up. But who am I kidding. Maybe I'm just talking to myself, after all. Really? You wanna leave, already?
Sure, let's go on an adventury!
Forest shouldn't be far. Northeast, I think?
Can't you take a hint? This is for your own good!
You're awfully pushy for someone trying to help.
I've got better things to do!
What an odd fellow you are!
At least I'm not a bot.
Eccentric to say the least! Though I bet he's far more gentle and soft towards the forest's inhabitants! ♥
I wonder what his deal with Tanner is...
You remember your second visit to the custom's office?
Yeah! I think my line was: 'That was surprisingly productive!'
Third time's the charm, huh? So... What's on the menu?

Alright, I guess. Some days are better, others are worse. Time seems to pass a lot quicker, though. Think I'm finally getting used to it. I guess that makes two of us, hm? Sorry. I haven't been talking to people a lot, lately.
Stopped seeing me around three months ago.
He got what he wanted. I told him the entire thing. Funny, isn't it? Three years in Tartarus... Just like that.
So it was you, after all.
Hm. He had it coming, I guess. On that note... I think I owe you an apology.
Don't worry about it. You did what you thought was right. Just like the rest of us. In any case... I can arrange for you to see someone else, if you want. Someone who can keep his mouth shut.
You don't get it, do you? It doesn't matter who I talk to. I've played my part. The rest is up to you.
Bullshit! Listen... I can't even begin to comprehend the things you must've gone through. But you know this isn't the end of the road for you!
Do me a favour, will you? Drop that in a bin on your way out.
I can't force you to read it. And frankly, I'd like to leave the choice to you, anyway. But if you're going along with this... Please, do it soon.
You might be the one to visit me, next time.
I see. Alright. You got my word.
Thank you. I'll be going, then.
If you know what's good for you... You better pray that they'll never let me leave this place.
Hm. I guess we'll see about that.
Man... Can this guy get himself a typewriter, already?
I could just delete you, you know?
Yeah? Is that how you handle problems around here?
There's more than a billion people going hungry.
There's not much I can do.
Then there's no reason to beat yourself up about it.
Sorry to burst your bubble... But money is so last century!
Didn't think we'd ever see the day bartering gets a renaissance!
I think you might be confusing us with someone else.
Not at all! Three vagabonds from afar, it said. Strong-willed heroes, not to be deterred by any force, be it man or nature.
What exactly am I witnessing here?
Not really. She mistook me for someone else. Let's see if we can get an appointment with the councillor.
Give me a second, I'll set the table.
Just a tiny bit more salt... There... Now it's perfect!
Certainly smells great from where I'm standing!
Oh, excuse me! I didn't hear you come in. Can I help you, by any chance?
Whatever it is you're cooking there, I want some!
There's something I want to check out real quick... Mind accompanying me?
Sure, I guess.. Well, I'll see you later, then. Thank you very much for your time!
It says here that the custom's office denied your request. How did "Atlas" react to this state of affairs?
You don't need to emphasize his designation like that...
Our original schedule had us inside Trachi, at that point. So I'm guessing he was pretty pissed. At least he wanted to appear that way.
What do you mean by that?

As you know... Most people working the field aren't particularly proud of what they're doing. But Atlas... He played the self-loathing type way too well. So I had a feeling that he not only hated himself for the things he did. But for the way he came to enjoy them.
That was the first time you met Lieutenant Tanner?
Were you aware of his affiliation at that time?
He struck me as the kind of person who's only looking out for themselves. So yeah... I knew he couldn't be trusted.
Shouldn't you be asking her that question, instead?

Let me put it this way... Everyone who deals with Tanner thinks exactly the same thing. He might be a backstabbing son of a bitch. But I can use him. That's what Faber thought. And so did I. I imagine Daphne felt something similar, as well.
Mind turning that thing down a bit? I'm starting to lose focus.
We entered Nestville... As I said. It felt... Peculiar. Wooden houses, most of them. Frontier village.

Seriously... What are you trying to prove here? Are you insane?! They were eager... Willing. Prospective. !!! But all of them... Left something behind. Waiting. Lurking. Looming. Threatening to catch up.
Opening boxes that should stay closed.
Yeah. And you're on your feet again.
Still a bit shaky. But getting better by the minute.
Listen... I'm sorry for what happened, last night.
It's alright. We weren't supposed to be in those sewers, anyway.
So... How did your meeting with Faber go?
As expected. He's a bunch of work, to put it mildly.
Did he say anything about what happened at the checkpoint?
He claimed that Amryn somehow got wind of our plans. And that he was forced to put up a show.
You think he's telling the truth?
Who knows... But I intend to find out. You know where Amryn's embassy is?
Uhmm... It's west of here, isn't it? In Gharten Street, I think?
Precisely. Just head across Trenton Plaza and keep to the northwest. The embassy is the first house to your right.
Don't know if you've seen it... But they're conducting identity checks on some of the bridges.
Yeah, there's Guardsmen all over the place. You've been to Trachi before, right?
Some time ago, yeah. But it felt very different, back then.
In any case. Faber gave me the papers he promised.
You want me to use them?
You sure about that? Feels like he's just gonna try to track us with that.
I see. So what do you want me to do?
Nothing extraordinary. Just keep an eye on the embassy. See who enters and who leaves. If what Faber says is true... They're likely to use something, or someone, to communicate with the leak.
Makes sense. Alright. I'll be back later, then.
Can you charm her up a bit?
Exactly. Let Daphne handle the rest.
I'll go and get into position, then. See you there.
Yeah, I'm good to go. Thanks for asking!
Don't worry about it. How did your survey go?
Alright, I guess. Though it's hard to make sense of it all.
I heard the same. But I guess we'll have to see what happens. Apparently, Amryn has also heavily increased their presence within the city.
It's hard to tell. But I intend to find out. Have you been to Gharten Street, yet?
Nope. It's west of here, isn't it?
Yeah. Just cross one of the bridges, and orient yourself northwest of Trenton Plaza.
Once you're there, you should see a big, old-style building to your right. That's the Amrynian embassy. I want you to keep a watch over that place. And make note of anyone entering or leaving it.
All good, don't worry. It just... Feels like we're about to cross a line with what we're doing.
Don't know if it makes you feel any better... But it's not easy on me, either.
I wasn't sure, to be honest. You always seem so confident. Got me a bit envious, to be honest!
Awww... That's how you see me? Guess I'm that good at hiding it.
Have you ever done anything like this before?
Thought as much. So, what's next?

I'm gonna relay that the stage for tonight is set. As for you... One of our contacts in the Guard has asked for a meeting. Normally, Atlas would handle stuff like that. But he's off on some goose-chase after one of Amryn's people. So I guess you'll have to do the honours.
His name is Arnold Francesco Solka.

Sort of. We know something he doesn't want us to know. So we do each other a little favour, here and there. Anyways... There's a chance our hit tonight won't be enough. If that's the case... We'll need his troops.
There's more. Tanner might become a problem, down the line. So, hopefully... Solka can fill in some of the gaps for us.
The prefecture in Sigmund Plaza. His office. Second floor.

You'll be running under the identity of a corporal named Theodore Harrington. The name's in their books, so it should stand scrutiny. And of course... We also got you a uniform. So as long as you're not sniffing around too much... You'll be fine.
Alright. I'll go and get changed, then.
It's a bit stiff in places. But it'll do.
Don't do anything I wouldn't do.
He went to the custom's office, but I lost him in there.
I see. If Amryn has someone in the administration, it could be problematic.
We'll have to make find out who's on our side, first. Can you deliver a message for me?
There's a wine trader in Clarin square. Ask him for a Chariot 1896. And give him this.
And while you're there... Would you mind keeping an eye on the custom's office after you're done?
Good. I'll see you later, then.
Yup! I trailed a guy from the embassy to Hudsman. He dropped a message just north of it.
A bunch of numbers. Let me think... 9799... 2345... 7542. Can you make anything of it?
I'm not sure. It's been a while since we've gotten hold on one of their books. But I'll check it out. Did you see who's on the other side?
Yeah! He went into that house over there.
So I might as well keep watch from up here.
I see. Don't let me keep you, then.
Oh, I almost forgot. I came across Tillian.
Is that so? Anything important he had to say?
Not really... But it made me remember something. That councillor we met in Nestville...
He used to be the administrator of Rondham, until last year.

Shortly after Trachi declared its independence, there was a heated discussion on how to handle citizenship. Rondham has always harboured a lot of Ionians, among other foreigners. As you know, the provisionary parliament decided to make Trachian citizenship exclusive. In other words, a lot of Ionians had to either relinquish their original citizenship... Or pack their things and leave. Naturally, Ionia wasn't exactly pleased about that. So they tried to kill that motion.
Yup. Mainly because Faber backed it. Most foreigners in Trachi didn't care much about it. But some of them decided to return to their home country. Others went to the DMZ and founded Nestville.
He lost a significiant part of his electoral base. And was unseated by another candidate during last year's election.
I see. Can I ask you something?
Our little detour through Nestville... Was that planned?
What do you mean by that?

Well... To me, it looks like we've just followed a script. The chicanery at the checkpoint... And it just so happens that there's this village, nearby. You can't tell me that the option wasn't on the table.
If that were the case, we could've saved ourselves a lot of time if we just went there, directly.
But we needed to keep up the facade. We're not really here to negotiate. Are we?
Depends on who you're asking. But as far as Faber is concerned... We don't expect him to cooperate.
So we're gearing up for war?
Not if we can prevent it. Which is why we should keep our eyes on what's in front of us.
Right! I totally forgot about that! Thanks, though.
Not gonna make that mistake twice.
Looks like they're not back yet. Might as well change and get going.
I'm not sure. But there's something in the air.
You know where the Old Admirality is?
Think it was on the eastern tail of the city, right?
I'm afraid we left them at home. I'll bring them with next time!
Thank YOU for doing your duty so admirably!
Yeah, I'm good. Just my first time in the city.
Yeah, this place really packs a heat during August. Make sure to drink a lot and keep yourself cool!
No problem, mate. Hope you have a good time here. And if you want to have a REALLY good time... There's this brothel down in Karlin Street-
I appreciate it, but I'm gonna have to pass on that.
He went in through that door.
That's where he lives? Hmm... Might as well report back while I'm here.
Hey, you! Have I seen you around here before?
Sorry, was just having a look around.
Well, go loiter somewhere else. There's people trying to work here, if you haven't noticed.
Now to find a spot where I can see who's passing by... Like that conveniently placed bench over there.
Looks like he's heading to Rondham.
Yeah. How's your stay in Trachi, so far?
Pretty overwhelming, I've got to admit.
It's a lot to take in, for sure!
What about you? Did you manage to take care of your stuff?
Yeah... I guess you could say that. Looks like I'm gonna have to stay in the city for a while, though. So if you ever need a guide or anything, let me know.
Will do! Right, I gotta go. I'll see you around!
Yeah, for sure! Have a good one!
Alright. Time to check out that alley, back there.
Oh? Someone seems to be in a rush.
All good! Just having a look around. Don't let me keep you!
Heh. How much do you want?
Oh... You're not here because of that?
Just out of interest... What do you got?
How do I know you're not one the Guardies?
You don't. But there's one right over there. Want to go and ask him? Just kidding, of course! Not like he'd believe me, anyway. Right?
I see. Thank you for sharing that with me.
No problem, man. And good luck.
... W-what? W-where am I? Wait a second... Am I... ...Home?
... Again? What the fuck is going on with me?
Hmm... There's letters... D-... Dea... I can't make them out.
I know you can do it!
Did someone leave you a message?
I already know what it says.
Please, I need to see what's in there.
Alright. Don't say I didn't warn you.
Let's put it this way: These guys were so riled up... I almost joined them!
Pretty nervous. But I guess that's to be expected.
Just finished his speech. Should get underway, soon.
Is that so? Ganymede, was it, right?
Great! Because I'm sure you'll do, too!
Come on, Iky... I'll be fine!
You're right. Think I'm just sad to see you go. But I guess nothing lasts forever.
Yup. It was fun, though! And I'm sure we'll see each other again, sometime!
Yeah, about that... I gotta tell you something.
Oh, please! You think it's the first time I'm doing this? I'm not gonna run around and tell every- body!
She's got her own mind and everything. But she will find out.
So I think it's only fair... If you knew about her, too.
Not that it's any of my business. But if you want to get it off your chest, I'll listen.
The sunset really is something else!
Hm? We're already at the port?
The big building over there... That's the Old Admirality?
Can you give me a couple of minutes?
Sure! I've got a folding chair right here!
Yo! I was just on my way back. Did you hear it, too?
Yeah. Something must've happened at the checkpoint.
And you? Did you find anything?
Nope. I followed the guy to the OA. But lost him there.
Just wondering... Daphne told me she gave you something.
Shit! I totally forgot about that.
I can do it, if you don't want to.
It's fine. I'll do it. Let's see... Hm? It's... empty?
She's testing you, Ganymede. I've got a question for you. When you fell into the sewers, last night... Was that planned?
You were pushed, weren't you? Ganymede?
Triumvirate entrance confirmed. That's what the message said.
Me and her... Know each other.
I took something away from her. A long time ago.
If shit hits the fan... I might as well not just go back. Now, Ganymede... I'll give you something special. A choice. I don't expect you to trust me. So I'll show it to you.
I heard someone's not playing straight.
Because of who you're working for.
If you're implying that it's me...
That's not what I meant. We've kept you in the dark deliberately. That's you've been out cold the entire morning.
Sorry, it took me a bit.
About time one of you guys showed up! Do you have any idea- Greg?!
Nevermind that. How about you tell me what the fuck's going on, instead?
It's a long story. And we don't have a lot of time.
So that's how it is, huh? First you fuck off with that EnKAD girl... And now you won't even tell me why.
I'm sorry, Timo. But it's vital that the IIS doesn't know what I'm up to.
I wish. But I need you to stay in your role for a bit longer.
Did Fero tell you about arteria?
Gregor... I'm running out of patience, here.
Alright. Let me bring you up to speed. In a few months, the IIS will send another group of operatives to Trachi.
Cool. Maybe I should participate. And then go dark for two years, without telling you.
I'm sorry, Timo. But I didn't have a choice.
I think you should take part.
Have you ever heard of an agent called Atlas?
Because we'll choke the city until it's on its knees?
Pravoskos has personally chosen the EnKAD personnel.

One of them being a twelve-year veteran, going by the codename "Atlas" He's distinguished himself during the FPR insurgency in 1917. And thus helped Pravoskos become head of EnKaD. Atlas, on the other hand, was seemingly content on working in the field. Some people just can't live without the trill of it, I guess. In any case... He's also been to Trachi before, two years ago.
Wait a minute... You're saying that the guy EnKaD sent to get our people back... That was him?
I never understood why we let them mettle in our affairs, like that.
We had to. After all, one our operatives was a former member of EnKaD. Working more or less directly for Pravoskos, at that.
The operation went south though, didn't it?

Correct. And to this day, I'm still lavishing in the memory of that smug smile vanishing from Pravoskos' face, for once. In any case, said operative remains one of the top agents in his field. And I would assume that he'll be able to draw from the networks he's established during his last venture into the city.
Alright. Already sounds like I'm in way over my head... But go on. What about the other one?

A young woman from the psychological division. She's also been to Trachi, but merely as an attaché. Regardless, she as well has performed exceptionally in the past. Have you ever heard about the Leucippus-Incident?
I read about it. Wasn't he the enforcer that killed some guy he was supposed to bring in for questioning?
Exactly. After being reprimanded by his CO, he went rogue and threatened to go public. So EnKaD sent someone to negotiate. Thirty-six hours later, Leucippus turned himself in.
Sounds like I'm being thrown to the lions.
What do you think of it?
That depends on where your loyalties are.
Isn't that what they always say?
Perhaps. But I think you'll agree that something needs to be done.
Still... If word of that comes out...
Well, you've got a lot more to lose than I do. But I'm not sure whether I can do this. I've never been to that city. And it's going to be me against everyone else.
I wouldn't be so sure about that.
There's someone else working towards the same goal.
I don't know his identity. But the information he relayed has proven to be on point, so far.
Hm... What if it's a scheme by Pravoskos?
It's certainly a possiblity. But it would be highly uncharacteristic of him.

Listen, Ganymede. I wouldn't put this on you if I wasn't one hundred percent certain of your abilities. These people from EnKaD... They're used to be in control of their environment. In Ionia, no one can touch them. So I would assume that they can't help but bring a sense of complacency with them. You on the other hand... You've been able to adapt to almost any environment, so far. And it is my firm belief that you can turn your limited experience in Trachi to your advantage. In other words... Let them be in control, if they want. But try to be a nuisance at every opportunity.

Likewise! Say, I was wondering if you could help me... The thing is, I have an urgent meeting in town... But every counter is occupied at the moment... So I was curious if you've got any extra personnel available?
I'm sorry, sir. But I'm afraid we don't have anyone to spare.
I'm sure one of our employees can be with you shortly. Feel free to make yourself comfortable in the waiting lounge, until then.
Alright. I'll go and wait there then. Thanks for your assistance, though.
Hm. Guess that's the end of the road, for now. I should wait outside and see if he comes back.
First, you should apply for citizenship.
Oh no... I have a bad feeling about this.
Don't worry! This won't take long.
I'll take your word on that.
There's a waiting area over there if you want to sit down. In any case, I'll be back in a sec.
Sure, just don't make me wait to long.
Boy, do I hope you're right.
Well... The guy I needed to speak to is on lunch break. So I guess I'm gonna have to wait until he's back.
Yeah. No need to wait on me, though. Actually, could you do me a favour and drop this off at our place?
Yeah. Our man left it behind.
Alright. I'll see you later, then.
First house to the right, he said.
Should be it. Now to find a good spot to watch it from.
9799... 2345... 7542. Alright. I think I got it!
Oh, just you wait! For now, let's put this back... And see if someone's coming for it.
Right, that confirms it! Now where's he going with that?
To you, as well! Sorry about the disturbance. I recently moved into the neighbourhood and wanted to say hi.
Oh, how nice of you! Too few people do that nowadays.
I know, right? It's very important for me to know my neighbours. I'm Terrence Firaun, by the way. Or Terry, for short.
Pleased to meet you, Terry! I'm Liliane Hendrick. But you can call me Lily. Which house did you move into, if I may ask?
It's right over there. See the one with the stuccoed gable?
Exactly! I've got to say, Trachi has some amazing architecture. So I'm very excited to emulate some of the work in my own, once I return to Stratfurt.
How wonderful! Then I'm sure you'll enjoy your stay in this neigh- bourhood very much.
If everyone is as accommodating as you are, I'm sure. That's a really nice house you got there, by the way!
Oh, thank you! Though I'm sometimes a bit embarrassed living in such a mansion right in the heart of the city.
How long have you been living here?
Around three years. My husband insisted on living close to his place of work.
That would be Mr. Hendrick then?
Precisely! I'd love for you to meet him... But he's out on an errand, right now.
Don't worry about it! I think I've taken up enough of your own time already, anyway.
Not at all! I always appreciate getting to know my neighbours a bit better. Oh, look! There he is. Welcome back, darling! Come and say hello to our new neighbour.
Pleased to meet you! I'm Terrence Fusilier. And I assume you're Mr. Hendrick?
That's right. Now, I'm sorry... But I need to take care of something, urgently.
Oh! I'm the one who should apologize. I think I should be going, anyway. But it was nice meeting you two!
Don't worry about it. Say... Me and Lily were about to have brunch in a bit. And knowing her, she prepared way too much. Would you mind joining us?
Well... I don't know what to say.
I'll take it as a yes, then! See you inside!
No point going back in there.
Time for me to say goodbye, as well.
I can't be seen running through their house too much.
Let's see... There's tomatoes, carrots and radishes. That leaves... Onions, garlic and potatoes. Would you mind getting those from the pantry?
What were we looking for again?
Onions, garlic and potatoes it was.
How's it going with the onions?
Say... Would you mind if I open a window? My eyes have gotten a bit runny.
Mhh, I don't think so. We're about done, anyway. Just need to let it simmer for a bit.
I'll do the washing up. Feel free to rest up a bit.
You sure you don't want any help with that?
Absolutely! You already did more than enough.
Okay. I'll make myself comfortable, then.
Brunch should be ready in a minute.
Yeah, about that... I'm terribly sorry, but I just remembered that I urgently need to be somewhere.
Yeah... Wish it could wait, but there's nothing I can do, I'm afraid.
That's a shame. I feel very embarrassed putting you to work like that and not even giving something in return. How about you take some of that stew with you?
Okay... But only a tiny bit.
Hold on! This is way too much!
Not at all! We prepared lunch for four people, after all!
I think Drenem was discussing a few things with someone, upstairs.
Can't say I did. What were they talking about?

I don't know. I tried not to listen too attentively, since it's none of my business. Though Drenem sounded like he got quite worked up. He really should take it easy, sometimes. In any case, I think I heard her leave, just now. So I guess it's up to you to take her share.
Alright, if you insist. Thank you very much! I'll stop by again, sometime soon.
Please do! You're always welcome! And thank you for helping me out, as well.
Don't mention it! Please give my best regards to Mr. Hendrick as well. Once I'm properly accommodated... I'll make sure to invite the two of you over!
I'm looking forward to it! Hope you have a splendid day. And please let me know how the stew was.
Apologies if it's not looking as fine as it should. But as you can see, there's a lot of room to clean. And since we don't have a maid anymore... It's a real struggle to keep all of it in good shape.
Don't worry about it! It looks great!
Thank you! I'm going to head into the kitchen and prepare a stew.
Mind if I help you out?
Are you sure? I'm not too fond of putting guests to work.
It's no problem at all! I'd be more than happy to repay the hospitality!
What went through your mind when you saw Icarus dead?

I think it was something like: 'I'm sorry, Niky. Really. You were one of a kind. Brave, and always eager. You turned a chicken house into a palace for me. I wanted to return that favour. But there you are. Taken the bullet intended for me. Rest easy, my sun and stars. Because I'll put a stop to this, I swear! And more importantly... Make sure that bitch will pay for it!'
I'll see you on the other side.
I should go back to the Safehouse and change.
I need to close the door.
There's marks all over his neck. Poor guy.
I need to get some info first.
What's the name of the book?
Autonomy - How Trachi reclaimed itself "Trachi - A history of freedom"
I know, right? Totally not full of themselves, are they?
Let's see how long they can keep their freedom.
What else was in that room?
Just a couple of books about the region.
There was also a special book.
Uh... Let's not talk about that.
Tell me about this one over there.
Hm. A codebook. Shit. What were the numbers again? 9799 2345 something something. That makes... Triumvirate entrance- acknowledged?
Almost like someone put this here, deliberately.
Construction plans? Wait a second. This is... Fredrick Dam?
There's other people like you, too.
Man... This is even bigger than I thought.
Wait... Those are about Nestville. They knew we were going there.
I doubt there's any point in that, really.
Skipping straight to the violent part?
Unless there's something you want to share with me?
Not really. I mean... You could just let me go.
Nice try. But you're in no position to demand anything. Found towering over a dead body. An official of the state, no less. Very, very bad business.
Right. And I gotta say... That was a really nice setup! Couldn't have done it better, myself!

You killed that man. And not only that... You also disguised yourself as a member of the Guard. That's right. I know you were sniffing around. Even met with the Colonel. So I wonder... What's it you're after? Trying to dig up some dirt on me, hm? Why so quiet all of a sudden?
Hm? Oh... Sorry! I think I fell asleep for a second, there. Would you mind repeating what you said?
This... Will be interesting. What were you doing in that apartment?
Sorry, but that's none of your business.
I gotta admit. You're tougher than I thought.
You're really enjoying this, aren't you?
Haven't heard a worse lie in years.
I'd rather you just give me answers, instead.
There's nothing for me to tell you. And let's face it. You're not looking for answers, anyway.
Whatever you say. But since you're still not talking... I'm forced to use more drastic measures.
Woah! That's a big knife! Are you sure you can handle that?
There you are again. Can't have you spacing out like that. It's a nice trick, though, I gotta admit.
Sorry... I know you're giving it your best. It's kind of adorable, in its own way. But if you want this to work... You really need to step up your game.

Big words. But you can't keep this up, forever. Whereas I... Have all the time in the world. Are you serious? No. Really? That's bad. Alright. It's a pity. But understandable. Agreed. I'll be there in a minute. Looks like you got lucky. You're free to go.
I see. Bit of a shame, to be honest... I was just starting to get into it.
Whatever you say. You can grab your things at the reception. 'Till next time.
I think so. Time to head back.
Do you want to come in? Dinner is ready.
I'll be there in a second. Let's go inside, Anton. Hey! Don't get too jumpy! Stop it! Hahaha! Careful with your paws! Anton, please! You're hurting me!
It's okay. Not that I mind... But are you sure meeting like this is a good idea?
The more obvious the better. We're at war now.
Don't worry. We're ready. Thanks to you.
For the record. It wasn't my-
Good. Anyways. We better get going.
Didn't think the Guard had any spine left in 'em.
Oh, I'm terribly sorry, sir! I didn't mean it like that!
Now, I'll pretend I didn't hear that. But I would be more careful about what I say from now on, if I were you.
Glad we understand each other. Carry on, citizen.
N-naturally! Hope you have a nice day, sir!
So that's the parliament, hm? I'd really like to see what's inside. Oh, hey. Sorry – I didn't see you there.
Mhh... Say... Would you like to go a date with me?
Oh my! So hesitant... So timid! It's decided, then! Come on. I don't have all day!
I'm really sorry... But this is all a bit sudden, you know.
Hogwash! Love doesn't care for earthly time. Set yourself free... Become one with your desires! And with me, if you like~
Yeah, I think I'm gonna pass, thank you. But you know, I have a friend... Tall guy, blue eyes. Moustache and combed back hair. Can't miss him.
Oh, I think I've seen someone like that, before! He looked so stern, I didn't dare.
He's pretty shy. It's just a mask, believe me.
Yeah, don't worry! I'm sure he'll be thrilled to get to know you better.
Great! I'm looking forward to seeing him, then~ And of course... We can still have our little fling, if you want~
Another time, maybe. Anyways, I gotta go. Was nice meeting you.
Oh, and please don't tell my friend about this conversation. You know, shy and such.
Of course! It'll be our little secret~
Sorry Timo. But you know how it is.
Then tell me about it! I won't play courier if I don't know what's going on.
You do realize that if you're caught...
Knowing less is better? For you, maybe. But I'll need something to buy myself out, if push comes to shove.
You know I'd find a way to-
Would you, really? Because I know things about you? Or because I'm your brother?
Can you please not mention that here?
Alright. You win. I told you about our new arrival, didn't I?
Yeah. She brought a gift with her. I only had a brief look at it. But it looks like they're planning a hit on Fredrick Dam.
Exactly. If that dam gets destroyed, there'll be massive floods in the entire area.
I don't see how that's our problem.
Trachi isn't part of Ionia, anymore. External affairs are our territory.
And you don't want them pissing on us.
If anything goes wrong... CoExA will be implicated, too.
In any case... Fero wants to check it out.
Then we at least know that someone's trying to bullshit us. This is too big to ignore. And they know it.
Alright. Who do I give this to?
Thanks. Looks like it's all there. Hm? A message? 17. Uhhh.... Where was that again? Oh, right! Okay. Let's go.
You've got to come with me.
Well, I'm not sure if the Lieutenant would appreciate not getting this report. I don't remember the exact date...
Hmm.. Sorry again for the inconvenience.
Appreciate your understanding. I'll be around, if you need anything.
Not really. I just recently joined the guard.
What am I supposed to see here?
You've just recently arrived, haven't you?
There are about forty-two thousand people living in Trachi. Add to that an uncountable amount of visitors.

Haven't you noticed... That there's barely anyone about? Of course you haven't. For you, this atmosphere is your natural habitat. The thing you create and foster in. Don't get me wrong. I know this city has its faults. And how rotten it can be. But at least people were able to walk the streets without fear.
I don't know how much you stand behind what you're representing. In any case... You need to be aware of the consequences your actions cause. For each and every one of them.
You're an impatient one. Just like he said.
One of your associates. The one who's made up his mind. This is why you're here, right? To find out if it's true.
You need to be more specific than that.
You've been in contact with that person?
One of my sergeants. A reclusive persona. But very thorough.
I would advise against it. He's not very welcoming to strangers.
Alright. He's on leave right now. Politics and such.
Then you've also seen the big apartment building there?
Second floor. Apartment 2-C. Tell him I sent you. Code phrase: "insubordinant briard".
One more thing: If you insist on visiting that man... Make sure to change beforehand. There's no telling how he'd react if some- one in a uniform turns up at his doorstep. Good luck.
Ha! Oh, you'll find out soon enough.

I know we're not always in control of our actions. And sometimes, we have to cross a line. Pledging that this is the last time, for real. But both of us know... It won't end. We'll do it again and again. And everytime, we get more entangled.
That's all nice and well... But I'm afraid I don't have time for philosophical debates. So if you don't have anything else to share, I'll take my leave.

Alright. Alright. Be aware of the consequences your actions cause. And don't trust anyone that is being pressured by someone else than you. And I doubt you've committed as many misdeeds as I have in my time. It's not too late for you.
I bet it was one of the Guardsmen. The people working the checkpoints are some real ruffians, I heard!
Don't worry. I won't tell on you. Or will I?
Please don't! I'm really, really sorry!
Relax! I'm just messing with you!
Haha, of course! But still... I'll be more careful in the future!
Careful there. That spot is pretty dangerous.
Gany... Jesus... What the hell did they do to you?
Don't worry about it. Just a few scratches, that's all.
Sorry you had to go through that.
I think it's time we talked. For real, I mean.
Is that so? Alright. Fire at will.
I know you killed Icarus. And I know that you did all of that just to get to me.
You were there, weren't you? Both you and Atlas. You naughty, naughty boys... Tucked away in that tight little bedroom. Listening eagerly. While I turned the man you loved inside out.
I'd rather we skip the bullshit.
To be frank... I couldn't give less of a shit about him. If I did... You'd be dangling from a streetlight, already.

Mhhh. Now that's more like it. I don't know if it's your battered face or the sudden change of behaviour... But it's getting me excited. Now, now... Don't stop! Because the moment you do... I'll tear you apart.

Oh, don't worry. I'm just getting started! Atlas told me something about you. How he visited your father, back when you were twelve. The delighted look on your face, every time he arrived. And the sobbing mess you became, as soon as he left. Love is an awkward thing, isn't it? When he told you that it was him... Who sold you and your mother out. Did your love for him stop? Or was that just the final push you needed?
Big words... But I've heard those a million times, already. Everyone thinks they can see through him. Believe me, I've been there. At some point... He'll trash you, too.

Maybe, yeah. But then again... I'm not half as deaf as you and the others are. I found something, Daph. Just before I was arrested. Records of our movements. Both in the past... And the future. The meeting with Solka was a setup. Trying to lure one of us into a trap. I walked into it. Because I wanted to make sure. I wanted to see it with my own eyes. Daph. I know you pushed me, back when we arrived. But I also know that in reality... You don't really care about me. For you, I'm just a tool. Because it's not me you're really after. It's Atlas. You want- No... You NEED to know. If the man... Who you just can't seem to shake off - Is a fucking traitor. I'll put your mind to rest, don't worry. Because I know something you don't. You're about to lose everything. Because if what Atlas is trying to pull off works... Ionia can kiss this city goodbye. So how about it? Are we friends again?
Yup. We better go upstairs. It's starting.
Alright. Through here. Up the ladder.
Ganymmede... I thought we were past this.
That's not what I mean. I'm not faulting you. To be honest, it's much a better cause than anything I have.
What is it for you, then?
I want to see something destroyed and then rebuilt. Over and over again.

Nice speech. But both us know you're just saying things. You're here because your boss wants my boss out. Everything else is just a narrative to cope with that fact. So tell me: Am I on the hitlist, too?
If I was supposed to kill you two...
You'd already be dead. But you know what? Fero can go fuck himself. I'm only doing what I do because it turns me on.

I'm dispatched to take this city off your hands. My goal was to crash operation arteria. And you're right! Fero picked me just for that. He knows about all about Kenović and how Atlas killed your dad.
Imagine my surprise when Atlas approached me yesterday. It was almost to good to be true! So simple... So utterly profane.
Everything that happened four years ago. How your boss got his girlfriend killed. Turns out I didn't need to turn Atlas – he's a traitor by himself.

That confirms it, right? Which means my job is done. Unless you'd want to make this more exciting. We could make great things happen, Daph. Unless, of course, you don't want to be friends with me again.
Are you absolutely sure this'll work?
Holding onto something for that long... You know how they are.
Yeah. If you want me to go, instead... I'll do it.
That's no good. Your boss wouldn't let you go. Not for anything in the world. No. It's gotta be me.
I'm sorry, Gany. If you want out... I won't hold it against you.
Don't mock me, please. I'd never forgive myself. And you know that.
I wish there was a way I could make it easier on you.
Well... Give me a reason to hold out. Make it worth it.

That's not what I mean. At this point... You probably figured out how I work. And what drives me. I fall in love with things. Or people. Because I want to make them mine. I cannot resist it. And I'll always be a victim to these feelings. I've thought about it time and time again. But I always end up at the same conclusion. Atlas... I'll have to fall in love with you.
What do you want me to do?
I was briefed on you, you know... Not the full story, of course. But I know there was a girl. She was more important to you than anything else in the world. So tell me... What was she like?
And that's the gist of it.
Okay. That explains a lot. But to be frank... I didn't expect you to have a side like this.
Sorry to burst your bubble. But I'm only human, after all.
Don't worry about it. I think it's adorable in some way. And I can definitely emphasize with it. It'll do.
Yup. I'll try! No promises, though. The moment shit hits the fan-
Why do you care about her in the first place?
If you were in my spot... Wouldn't you want the same?
I don't think so. As far as I can see it... It's what she does.
Maybe. Or maybe you just want to keep things pretty... Before you smash them to bits.

You're really something else, Atlas. It's like you're incredibly clever... But also insurmountably stupid, at the same time. Or "maybe" it's just me not seeing you straight. In any case. You're in it for the madness. Whether you like it, or not. There's something special about being in control. Right?
Somewhat, yeah. But I think I'm getting there.
Okay. It's about time I got underway.
Speak for yourself. But I for one don't give a shit about who you are. Because the only thing I see in front of me... Is a child.

Everywhere you go... You need to be center of attention. A life directed towards submission. But never the happy servant for very long. And so you drag yourself from high to low... Hoping to find something. Or someone. To latch onto forever. It's your sickness. And your addiction. If it weren't for someone pulling your strings... You'd have no idea where to go. Isn't that right? Timo?
You know what... One day I'll kill you.
Feel free to try. But for now... It's mutual assured destruction.
Solid finish. Alright. Let's do this.
Right. See you in a few.
Hey! You had us scared there, for a bit.
Only bits and pieces. Think I slipped or something. After that, it's just a big blur. How did I get here?
Atlas. You should have seen the look on his face! Don't beat yourself up. Some people enjoy playing hero, once in a while.
Yeah. Having a chat with Mr. Mayor.
Speaking of... I gotta get going, too.
Right. Sorry to keep you away from that.
No worries! It's your first time in Trachi, right?
How about you tag along? And I'll give you a lay of the land while we're at it? If you don't mind, of course.
Great! There's a bunch of clothes in that drawer over there. Unless you prefer to go out as is, of course.
I had to. You were drenched from top to bottom, after all.
Well, guess I can't hide anything from you, anymore.
You should have never tried to, in the first place. Anyways... I'll wait for you outside.
I didn't expect you to be so interested in a girl's room.
Sorry. Guess I took the wrong door.
Mhm. Just... Give me a second.
Where's mum and dad? Was that the door?
Hm... Something's different. Huh? What's that noise?
What are you waiting for? I know you're there.
Can you fill out this form for me?
As you said it. Feel free to take a seat over there, if you want. Fifteen minutes later...
Were you ever convicted? "What does the insignia of Trachi depict?" "Underscore the prime numbers in the following list." Is there a system to these questions, at all?
Apart from trying to provoke a killing spree, you mean?
You saw the queue at the gates, didn't you?
So they're trying to filtering people with this?
If they shut the gates... They'd violate the treaty, right?
You can't possibly imagine... How much I'm going to enjoy this!
At least you're honest about it.
Not really. But it's a nice change of pace.
Thank you. I hope you won't mind if we jump right into it.

I have a theory. About the way you work, I mean. And why no one knows anything about you. There's a little place in your mind. Almost as old as you. Everytime your bratty mouth gets you into trouble... You disappear inside.
I'm flattered. But I don't think it's anything to write home about. You've got one of those, too, don't you? Dotty?

We all do. Some need a little nudge. Others require a special key. You see... There's just way too much bullshit coming out of your mouth! So I can't trust anything you say. Whoops! Very sorry! Hey! You okay, down there? Good! Anyways... Where was I? Oh, right! Fortunately for me... There's more than one way for a body to express itself. So I'm just gonna keep going... Until I find out who you're really working for.
I missed you. How are you holding up?
I'm not sure what kind of answer you're expecting. But I'm alright, I guess.
Well, I'm happy you enjoyed the appetizer. And I think we're both ready for the main course.
How nice of you to join in on the fun! Ouch... That one kinda hurt, you know.
Jesus fucking christ! How do you think I would know?!
Three down... Seven to go. I hope you'll last through all of them. You know what comes after that, right?
Sorry for putting you through this. But for some reason, I'm dragging you into this place with me. And I think you can understand... That I'd rather be here than there.
Let's forget about that for a moment, okay? Because there's more important matters at hand. I was about to ask if you enjoy seeing this kind of stuff. But to be honest, it's all the same to me.
What are you even talking about?
You see... For all I know, you are either a god or just a voice in my head. That, too, doesn't really matter. Because you're there. And that means the world to me.

That's fine. It's time for me to go back anyway. I wonder how many fingers they've left intact. Man, that shit is going to hurt for months... Then again, what's a few broken bones for an entire city? And besides... I think it's time for everyone to find out, anyway. Including you, of course!
